scraped_reviews.content: App not working. I just tried to sign up, and my subscriptions page says that I am subscribed but have to confirm my subscription, so I'm unsure if I'm currently being charged. Trying to sign up again just gives me an error message that I'm already subscribed, but trying to use "restore my subscription" just results in an endless loading screen. UPDATE: I found a work around by choosing "login with a different email" and choosing the sign in option.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Rachele - Thanks for sharing your experience. Mind contacting our team at help.marvel.com. We would be happy to help troubleshoot accessing the Marvel Unlimited subscription with you.

scraped_reviews.content: I use this app every day. I would love to see a "download series" or a multi comic select option when downloading more than one comic. As well as a better way to filter comics, more specifically in the downloads tab. if it was similar to the library tab (or consolidated into the my comics tab) I think it would make finding and filtering your downloads more intuitive. other than that the app is great for all your marvel comic needs.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey Daniel - Thanks for the review. Awesome to hear that you're loving Marvel Unlimited! We'll pass your feedback about filtering downloads along to the team.

scraped_reviews.content: I love being able to read comics that are valuable to me, without actually having to touch them. And I love being able to read comics and series that I've always wanted to read without actually having to buy them so that I can decide whether or not I want to collect that particular series or find hat first edition physical book, this is a great app and i'm glad there's finally something like that out there.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey Justin! Thanks for the 5 stars! Shrinking down the comics, just like Hank Pym, to be able to carry them with you anywhere!

scraped_reviews.content: subscription based If you're thinking this is just a free read, it's not. I can't even get to the main screen without paying. Read the fine print, and it does state that a subscription is required. I'm giving it a three for average because I already spent 45$ on comics, and I dont wanna spend more for just digital. yes,for some ,that is easier and more convenient. I just prefer digital. I'm almost 30, I suppose I'm an old man. I was just hoping this was a fun little free deal. Not bad or good
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi there - We appreciate you sharing this feedback.  Marvel Unlimited is a subscription based service. We do have promotions periodically running to help our guest experience the service. If you are a first time subscriber you do also get a 7-day free trial to see if it is right for you. For the latest promotions please check us out on marvel.co...

scraped_reviews.content: I went to sign my grandson up so he could read the free comics and I could share some of my digital collection with him. They now absolutely require payment via subscription to use the app. I don't have that requirement, I assume because I was grandfathered in from the previous app. It is not worth $10 a month so he can occasionally read a comic. IMHO, the days of free are ending. The economy isn't good enough for needless spending like this. Just stay physical, it's cheaper.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey Codie - Thank you for taking the time share your experience, we truly appreciate your perspective, especially as someone who has been with us since the former app has sunset. While Marvel Unlimited requires a subscription to access our full digital library, we're always working to deliver as much value as possible - including thousands of co...

scraped_reviews.content: The app keeps freezing when I try to sign up for a subscription, making the entire thing unusable. I have tried uninstalling, force stopping, logging out, etc... Now I have to choose to give up entirely (like I apparently did years ago), or spend the evening emailing with developers/CS people. I also am kind of astounded that you have to wait at least 30 days to read current books. Not sure if this is really worth it.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey Chris - Thanks for reaching out to us! Please contact our team via help.marvel.com so that we can best assist with your subscription.

scraped_reviews.content: One of the best apps on my phone/tablet and one of the subscriptions I plan on keeping. Every page is so vibrant and crisp, reading on a tablet with a hint of yellow dialed in aka eye comfort is very reminiscent of reading a physical copy. At night when I'm laying down the panel view on a phone is so immersive I have to force myself to shut it down and not read just one more. Only thing I wish was a little better organization with the reading recommendations.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey Paul - thanks for the Fantastic 4 stars! We can certainly pass along the suggestion for further organization to the team for consideration.

scraped_reviews.content: Access to over 30,000 comics! Just what I needed! Why did you guys remove the point system (for instance agent tier). I thought it was really fun to see as I found it more motivational and maybe even exciting to read more comics than I usually do! I still hope you guys add a feature where comic book readers can rate the comic books that they've read on a scale from 1 to 10! Please add a section where I can see all the books I've read! Other than that, I couldn't be happier :)
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello there - Thank you for sharing this awesome 5 star review! Those are great suggestions and we will definitely pass them along to our team. We appreciate our "True Believers".

scraped_reviews.content: The app is fairly frustrating to use for someone be to comics, for the price there are a lot of quality of life improvements to be made. The most valuable would just be to allow adding a full character to your library. Also, adding the ability to select several comics at once when in the search to add to your library or to download. The button to open the menu to add to library or download is often difficult to hit and the overall experience of adding issues to your to read list is annoying.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey Thomas - thanks for reaching out! We'll be sure to mention those suggestions to our team for consideration during future updates

scraped_reviews.content: It's very easy to use and does a good job of translating paper media to the screen. i've been a little disappointed in the quality of pencil/color versus earlier eras. I stopped collecting in late 80's and the quality of those issues that I'm rereading seems much higher than newer issues. Also, finding new issues (or even collections of old/older issues seems to be harder to find than it should be. I've just started reading on a screen versus paper and it's a bit of a disruptive change.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, Jeff - Thanks for reaching out and sharing this feedback with us! We'll pass your comments along to the team

scraped_reviews.content: The new version is pretty ugly. Now the 'Continue Reading' list is far down the main screen, unlike how it used to be at the very top and easily accessible. Navigating each comic series is a chore. You have to click the comic you want, click on keep reading, and then click on view full series. All that just to go back even one issue. And the comics load slower than ever.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for checking out the latest version of the MU app, and for your thoughtful review. We really appreciate your feedback and have passed it along to our internal teams. If you have any questions, please reach out to us at help.marvel.com.

scraped_reviews.content: A great way to read Marvel comics! The subscription is kinda annoying but I understand it. Having old and new comics being readily available on my phone is super convenient. I only wish that you had better ways to browse. I've tried to find certain runs or issues and it's been kinda a hassle. And if you look for a certain character, you have to scroll through every issue they've been to try to find the one you want. So a great service with a few hiccups but definitely worth the money.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey, Celeste - Thanks for the review!! We'll pass your comments about Search within the Characters pages to our teams :)

scraped_reviews.content: Here's the usual process I go through when using this app.  I open a comic to read. The app either breaks or opens the comic. The text is too small to read. I try to zoom, only to realize there's no zoom feature. I try to use smart panels, but it cuts off half of the word bubbles. The comic crashes.  If only there was a way to just use the comixology app with my marvel unlimited account.  As of now I'm in subscribing.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, Ryan - We're very sorry for the crashing you're experiencing. Mind reaching out to our Marvel Customer Support team via help.marvel.com? We'd really like to troubleshoot!

scraped_reviews.content: Big fan of the app and service overall. Only thing I would say is that I wish the search and issue organization was a bit more intuitive. Otherwise, it's very convenient having the majority of the Marvel catalog on a single device. I never used to be one to read my books on a screen but over the last few years I've seen the benefit. I'm always going to prefer holding the book in my hands, especially being an omnibus guy, but you can't take a 1000-page hardcover everywhere.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey, Zach - Thanks for sharing this review with us!! We'll pass your feedback about Search and navigation to the team. Appreciate it :)

scraped_reviews.content: Failed to work when I needed it. I downloaded several comics to read for the 4 hour flight with no WiFi. It's supposed to have offline mode, but that doesn't work. Once I landed the only solution is to uninstall the app, restart the device, reinstall, re-establish purchase through Google play, re download offline comics. Just to get offline mode to work... Ridiculous. Guess I will go back to Comixology.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey, Lukas - We're so sorry to hear that you're experiencing Offline Mode issues. Mind contacting our Marvel Customer Support team via help.marvel.com so that we can troubleshoot? Thank you and apologies for the inconvenience!

scraped_reviews.content: Finding a series or character is relatively easy. Navigation between pages is simple, as expected.. but what I didn't expect is navigation between the panes, and even portions of larger panels! So, as you're reading the comic, you can actually swipe right through each box/pane/panel if you want. Makes the text easier to read on the phone and you can appreciate every panel to its fullest. Can't speak to a PC or tablet experience, yet.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey there - Thanks for the 5-star review!! We're SO happy to hear that you‚Äôre enjoying Smart Panel mode. That‚Äôs one of our favorite features too!!

scraped_reviews.content: Awesome selection of comics. App could use some organizational and quality of life work. Not being able to manually search for a specific thing, and instead having to scroll through the giant list was tedious when I just wanted to read Star Wars comics. Not to mention, when I would bookmark a comic and back up to get to the next one, it would take me back to the top of the alphabet again. Took way longer than it should've.

An extremely wide range of comics and collecting every main comic. You only have to wait 3 months for new issues so its similar to a movie going to streaming. I have been using for about a year and have read thousands of comics on the app. The subscription also has tons of deals avaliable so if you're iffy on getting the app, find one of the deals and you can get a few months for very cheap! This app has saved me thousands of dollars. All i need are the issues of darkhawk that are missing.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, Cole - Thanks SO much for taking time to leave your feedback, True Believer! Don't hesitate to request titles via help.marvel.com. We can't guarantee when/if a request will be granted, but rest assured a variety of classic and new comics are added every week.

scraped_reviews.content: Virtually unlimited selection (appropriately named, indeed). I could read for hours every day, if only I didn't have to worry about being an adult. I used to find Marvel Unlimited frustrating and not very enjoyable because the quality was very low. But they upgraded and now the quality is much higher at the same (now reasonable) price. Thanks!

I loved this app. I can't even read comics for more than a few minutes without the comics failing to load. I can't even download the comics to solve this problem. the library went from a perfect way to track my comics to barely useful. To fix the loading problem I have to delete the app completely and then reinstall. This deletes my downloads. I've been a customer for years, but I can no longer justify paying for the app.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, Larry. Sorry to hear about the issues you're experiencing. It may help to update to the latest version of the app, 7.6. If you're up to date and are still experiencing issues, please reach out to us at help.marvel.com so that we can help troubleshoot. Thank you!

scraped_reviews.content: I love this app. It's great to be able to read so many great Marvel Comics, past and present. The only downside is that offline reading is not the best. My job requires me to be gone for long periods of time without a cell signal or wifi. After a few days, I'm unable to access my downloaded titles. If there was a dedicated offline mode for the app when there is no signal like other apps I use, the rating would definitely jump to a 5 star for me.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Brian - Thanks for the awesome review! :) We are glad that you love Marvel Unlimited and we greatly appreciate your feedback regarding an offline reading mode. Take care, True Believer!

scraped_reviews.content: Have been a subscriber since the first year. Browse by date range was the ONLY way I used the app. I read the library in order as they were released so I could read them as intended. Also by removing the "read" tag it makes it very hard to remember what I've read or not based solely on the covers. New updated ruined the app and I will be cancelling my subscription unless these features return. The current app is useless to me as is.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, Shaun- We wanted to let you know that search by publication month and date is now possible in the latest MU update (7.7)! Check out our FAQ here: https://bit.ly/33afPhZ to learn more about what‚Äôs in this release. As always, we thank you for your feedback.

scraped_reviews.content: There's a lot of ways it could be better, but I STILL consider it a 5* app. Physical comics have been priced out of my comfort zone, so the value in Marvel Unlimited is perfect for me. More ability to organize would be a big plus--right now there's basically Your Library. I do like it when they organize some into an event so I can read them all even when they are in different series. Just wish I could read an Amazing and then not have to search for the Peter Parker that continues the story.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, Brian! Thanks for the awesome 5-Star review :) We appreciate your feedback and have passed it along to our internal teams.

scraped_reviews.content: Updated to the new version on my tablet (Tab S) and can't use the app. Immediately crashes after opening. Update: The Search By Date option has seemingly been removed, leaving me unable to find the issues that I didn't have a chance to read from last week. Update 2: I was automatically logged out of my account on my phone, and the system no longer allows me to log in. This app is now less than useless. Would give zero stars if possible.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi there ‚Äì We are very sorry to hear that you are experiencing issues with Marvel Unlimited. Please reach out to us at help.marvel.com so that we can better assist with your issue. Thank you!

scraped_reviews.content: New app is Terrible. If you want to read any of marvels 29,000 titles good luck finding what you want. Search doesn't work, the lists go on forever with random titles throughout. I still can't find the brand new day story arc even though I know it's Amazing Spider-man #546-564. I must of missed that specific series in the list after scrolling for 5 minutes and getting results for stuff that shouldn't be included. My subscription ends in Dec. if things don't change or improve I'm canceling.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, Brandon- We wanted to let you know that improved search/filter/sort features are now available in the latest MU update (7.7)! Check out our FAQ here: https://bit.ly/33afPhZ to learn more about what‚Äôs in this release. As always, we thank you for your feedback.

scraped_reviews.content: Great for reading through a series, awful for reading through events. If you are only reading through a single title, MU has you covered. If the Marvel comic universe were only made up of unconnected stories, this would be fine, but we all know the true scope. Readers making their way through an event, across titles, are given no help whatsoever upon finishing an issue. The only option available is the next in the title--you have to dig through the app to follow an event, book by book.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, Thaddaeus - Thanks for reaching out about this. Improving the reading experience for Series/Events is definitely something we're discussing with the team. We really appreciate your feedback as we work on future updates! Thanks again

scraped_reviews.content: I just read the Rogue and Gambit #1 and love how it develops like a well-scripted JRPG but without the frustration of level-grinding, since it is a comic and not a game. Anyway, another nice feature is the addition of exclusive comics for Unlimited subscribers. Keep up the good work, everyone. :) Maybe in the future include the option to read paperback novels for especially eager readers.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey, Claude - Thanks for the review :) Awesome to hear that you're enjoying Marvel Unlimited!! We'll pass your feedback along to the team.

scraped_reviews.content: Loading Error on multiple series and titles. Started reading multiple series and after a few issues get loading error after loading error on multiple random titles. started reporting them, however there are so many it would take hours. can't finish series I started weeks ago because I can't read the next few titles in the series. This has been going on for weeks now, and I'm about to go back to sailing the high seas, because paying for this makes me want to go back to pirating for free.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey Chris - Thanks for sharing this loading issue with us. Mind contacting our team via help.marvel.com so that we can look into this for you?

scraped_reviews.content: It takes an extraordinary app to make me follow a review request to the play store. Marvel Unlimited is extraordinary. $10, and more comics than you can read. This beats the hell out of scrolling socials, or the majority of mobile games. There's a free week, set a calendar alarm for 6 days from when you sign up, and see then if it's worth keeping. For me, It is. I'd cancel Netflix over this.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello, Korp - We really appreciate you taking time to leave us a 5-Star review! Enjoy your reading journey through Marvel Unlimited. :)

scraped_reviews.content: Disappointed. I used to use the old Marvel Comics app. I'm not an avid comic reader, but did buy my favorites & liked that you didn't have to subscribe if you weren't into all the heroes. Unfortunately since Comixology shut down, I can't log in with my account here without having to purchase subscription. I don't even know what I can do to access my comics or get my money back. Disappointing.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, Meztli - Thank you for sharing this review with us. Rest assured, you don't need a paid Marvel Unlimited subscription to access your migrated digital comic library. Please contact our team via help.marvel.com so that they can assist!

scraped_reviews.content: It would be nice if you could search for a full series, not just by single issues. When im searching for specific characters and want to read the whole series, I have trouble finding them. It only pops up single issues, and I want the full series, to read from the beginning. So, making the search tool to be more user-friendly would be nice. otherwise, it's great.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey there - Thanks for sharing your review. We'll pass your feedback on expanding the search filters along to the team

scraped_reviews.content: While there is a ton of content here, the organization is pretty terrible overall. The few 'reading lists' provided are nothing more than listings of print runs, with proper chronological reading orders completely absent. I shouldn't have to consult a third-party website to view reading order lists when paying a subscription to the huge publisher behind these titles. Please take a look at these other websites and their reading lists, and do it right, Marvel. Piracy is looking very appealing.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, Richard- We wanted to let you know that search by publication month and date is now possible in the latest MU update (7.7)! For more info on what‚Äôs in the release, please see our FAQ here: https://bit.ly/33afPhZ. As always, we thank you for your feedback.

scraped_reviews.content: Five stars for the sheer volume of comics available to read at any given moment. Four for the app itself. Sometimes the smart panel cuts off words and you have to change it to full page, but not a deal breaker. Would also recommend making your account on the website and then log into the app. Oh, and unless you have a large phone, probably best viewed on a tablet 8" and up.

My biggest problems are that you can't remove comic from your library, not on the website, nor from inside the app, and that the read offline function is buggy as hell. Sometimes comics don't load even when connected to the Internet as well. I'm very likely to cancel my subscription when it comes up for renewal here. Step it up, Marvel. Edit: the app has gotten a lot better since I wrote my original review. Thanks for doing the right thing, Marvel.

The price is perfect. It's usually about 6 months behind for the new stuff. I use it for the series that I'm interested in, but not enough to get a subscription. But where it really shines is the back catalog. I started at Avengers Disassembled and have been making my way to the present reading every series I'm interested in in release order, multiple X-Men series, multiple Spider-Man series all in order. You can add what you want to a read list, and view it in order.

If it ain't broke don't fix it, and your fix broke it worse than ever. No more easy navigation back to home after finishing an issue, no more filter by read and unread issues, no more than five issues being remembered as recently read (which becomes a problem when I'm in the 1980s of Avengers and the weekly new comics are released, read the new comics, then have to re search) . Some of the new issues can't even be read and are only showing a retry button with "sorry, please try again later".

The new update really is quite bad. My app is crashing often, I can't get any issues to load on certain devices, etc. When it DOES work, the new interface for finding comics is slow and difficult, and essentially entirely independent on searches. My progress reading issues is all lost, the issues in my library are all in the wrong order, and it doesn't save default sorting preferences. Still 2 stars because the service itself is worth 5, but the new app is a hard 0.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Sorry to hear you‚Äôre having issues. We noticed that you‚Äôre on an older version of the app at the time of this review. We have added a lot of improvements and fixes in the most recent version which you can get by upgrading through the Google Play Store. If you‚Äôre still experiencing issues, reach out to us at help.marvel.com.

scraped_reviews.content: The value is solid. But I'm not a subscriber. The old marvel app was shut down and all of my digital library was moved to this app. I can't transition from one book to the next, I have to pull open the drop down, exit, find the next book in the series, click the icon, the click read. Pretty wild they actively choose to have a convoluted interface, especially for a paid subscription service.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey, Justin - Thanks for reaching out and sharing this feedback with us. We'll pass your comments along to our team. We really appreciate it!!

scraped_reviews.content: I can't express how much I loved the old UI it was so perfect and sorted my comics in the most perfect way so I could keep up with multiple stories at a time. Not only did I have to go back and find all my favorite comics again its tougher to find them. Everything is sectioned off now one of the things I loved about its old display was how I could see what other comics came out around the time the one I'm about to read took place.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, Cody! We wanted to let you know that improved search/filter/sort features are now available in the latest MU update (7.7)! For more info on what‚Äôs in the release, please see our FAQ here: https://bit.ly/33afPhZ. As always, we thank you for your feedback.

scraped_reviews.content: I love marvel unlimited. I love being able to read all the old classic comics, as well as so many new ones. Right now this app is completely broken, and it has been for at least a week now. At first it was just taking forever to load each page, now I can't read anything at all. Update: I uninstalled and redownloaded, it took several tries to log into my account, but comics appear to be loading again, kind of slowly, but it's working.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, Peter - Thanks for taking the time to share these comments with us! If any loading issues pop up again, don't hesitate to reach out to our Marvel Customer Support team via help.marvel.com.

scraped_reviews.content: Works well and great collection. Two downsides I've had are relatively minor; search doesn't always catch all appearances of a character, especially if they started before the 90's and smart pan doesn't always work right with older titles (although it does work for the large majority of titles). Also, I wouldn't use full page, anyways, but it's kinda useless when the pinch zoom resets immediately after zooming in.

Laughably bad. Or it would be if I weren't paying a subscription. It was once ok on a tablet, but the latest version freezes and crashes and takes four steps to do what its predecessor did in one. And they screwed up search, and made new issues clunkier to peruse. Supposedly all to make it work better for phones, which it doesn't do, and who wants to read teeny tiny comics anyway? I won't be renewing my membership if it isn't sorted.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi there ‚Äì We are very sorry to hear that you are experiencing issues with Marvel Unlimited. Please reach out to us at help.marvel.com so that we can better assist with your issue. Thank you!

scraped_reviews.content: Move over print, there's a new King in town! Love the panel by panel feature the most, I have a long commute and have been reading marvel masterworks, which are heavy, cumbersome and hard to read in train lighting at night. With Unlimited, I've read more comics than I could have ever imagined for the cost of about 3-4 trade paperbacks. I wish I would have bought this subscription sooner! I can't go back!

So far I'm loving the app. Huge collection of issues. Searching can be a pain unless you know the exact issue, volume, and release date. I say pain but it's not unbearable. The yearly subscription is a great deal considering the amount of issues in the library. I still prefer physical copies but the app is great for road trips or if you can't find the physical issue for your collection.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey, Anthony - Thanks for the review!! Awesome to hear that you're loving the app so far. We'll pass your feedback about the Search feature along to the team.

scraped_reviews.content: I want to start off by saying I do love this app. I can access most comics at anytime as long as i have my phone & good service. On the other hand it was a hassle in the beginning because they give you a free trail even if you choose to create an account & pay upfront. Sometimes even if the app does have the comic it can be difficult to find. Now it's saying to update my payment info & instead of going to my payment of choice they're making me make an entirely new account THAT'S IRRITATING.

Had Marvel Unlimited on my iPad Air for about a year and then cancelled. It wasn't because the app itself, more because the iPad. Fast forward a few years and the Pixel Fold was released. Having a tablet in the pocket at all times really transformed the way I used my phone. I was never big on downloading apps but with the Fold I have found myself downing tons of apps, particularly those related to entertainment. Please do what Google books does and allow the texts bubbles to expand!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey, Omi - Thanks for the review!! We'll pass this feedback along to the team :)

scraped_reviews.content: Current version is unusable. Half the pages don't load, spend way too much time loading (even connected to wifi), and haven't be able to read anything for days due to getting frustrated at minutes long loading screens. Not happy with this version at all. Do not recommend paying for a subscription until next update. Unacceptable all around.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Apologies for the issues you are experiencing. We are diligently working on this and hope to have a fix for issues as soon as possible. For any questions, please reach out to us at help.marvel.com.

scraped_reviews.content: Beautiful, easy-to-use interface that allows you to download issues to read while you're on wifi if you don't have unlimited data, and allows you to follow titles and characters to stay caught up. I only wish the website had the same features, because sometimes i like to read on my PC, and struggle to find the books I'm reading there. Please fix the website, so we can seamlessly go from reading on a handheld device to reading on a PC or laptop.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey, Brent!! Thanks so much for the 5-Star review :) We've passed your comments about the website to our Marvel teams!

scraped_reviews.content: It's amazing for the content and the guided reading on a phone or device. I almost gave 5 stars just for that. The search functions and navigation isn't intuitive, however, and reading events and collections isn't nearly as straightforward as I would expect. There doesn't appear to be a way to read events that span across multiple titles chronologically, instead defaulting to the title only. Meaning you have to go back and forth, sometimes getting lost.

For the most part this app is great. The comics look great. Turning pages is easy and you can even zoom in and the app will take you panel by panel and even move you around in individual, oddly-shaped panels. The cataloging of comics is kind of a mess. Sure, you can browse by whatever series you like or by character. That's pretty great, but the annuals aren't part of the main series, even though they take place in the same timeline. And you can't add an entire series to your library. Bummer.

title: Wanderlog - Trip Planner App
description:
The best app to plan a trip, Wanderlog is the easiest-to-use, completely free travel app for planning every kind of trip, including road trips and group travel! Create a trip itinerary, organize flight, hotel, and car reservations, view places to visit on a map, and collaborate with friends. After your trip, share a travel guide to inspire other travelers.

‚úàÔ∏èüõèÔ∏è See flights, hotels, and attractions in one place (like TripIt and Tripcase)
üó∫Ô∏è View road trip plans on a travel map & map your route (like Roadtrippers)
üñáÔ∏è Rearrange the order of places easily by drag-and-drop
üìç Planning a road trip? Add unlimited stops for free, optimize your route, view times & distances between places, and export places to Google Maps
üßëüèΩ‚Äçü§ù‚ÄçüßëüèΩ Planning group travel? Invite friends and collaborate in real-time just (like Google Docs)
üßæ Automatically import reservations by forwarding emails or connecting your Gmail
üèõÔ∏è Add things to do from top guides with 1 click (like Tripadvisor and Google Trips/Google Travel)
üìÉ Access your trip plans offline (Pro)
üìù Add notes and links to your stops
üì± Have your trip plans automatically sync across devices
üíµ Set budgets, track expenses, and split bills with a group

-------

üó∫Ô∏è SEE IT ON A MAP

Every time you add a place to visit, it‚Äôs immediately pinned on your Google Maps-based travel map. No need to pull up different travel apps and websites to organize vacation plans - you can do it all in the Wanderlog trip planner app! Plus, if you‚Äôre visiting points in order, lines will connect the different pins on the map so you can see your route (perfect for road trips!). You can also export all your places to Google Maps too.

üóìÔ∏è STORE PLANS OFFLINE

All your holiday plans are automatically stored offline on the Wanderlog travel planner app - especially helpful during a road trip with poor signal and international travel.

üöô GET ON THE ROAD

Looking for the best road trip planner? Travelers can plan their driving trips and stops with Wanderlog. See your route on a map, or try our route optimizer to automatically rearrange and plan your route to save travel time. See estimated times & distance traveled between places to make sure it all fits, and total time and distance traveled for a given day to make sure you‚Äôre not driving your car too long. Plus, you can add unlimited stops along your road trip for free.

üßëüèΩ‚Äçü§ù‚ÄçüßëüèΩ COLLABORATE WITH FRIENDS

For group travel planning, add your trip mates with their email address or by sharing a link to the itinerary. Like for Google Docs, everyone can collaborate in real-time. Set permissions and choose whether people can edit or just view your travel plans.

üóÇÔ∏è STAY ORGANIZED

Access flights, hotels, and attractions in one app. Forward flight and hotel confirmation emails to import them directly into your trip plan, or connect your Gmail to automatically add them. Prefer to keep high-level plans? Make generic lists like ‚ÄòThings to do‚Äô and ‚ÄòRestaurants‚Äô you want to eat at. Traveling on a tight schedule and want to create a detailed itinerary? Organize your day by adding start (and end) times, perfect for keeping track of tickets and reservations.

üåé GET INSPIRATION & INFORMATION

For each place, see key info like a description and picture of the place, average user ratings with links to reviews, opening hours, address, website, and phone number. Stay inspired by exploring top travel guides for every city from the web that feature viewpoints, attractions, and restaurants, and from lists from Google Trips and Google Travel, as well as by other Wanderlog users, and add things to do from those guides to your trip plan with 1 click.

üíµ MANAGE TRIP FINANCES
Set a vacation budget for yourself or a group. Take control of your spending and keep track of all expenses. For a group trip, split a bill with other people and easily calculate the cost. Keep a record of who paid for what, how much money everyone owes or is owed, and settle debts between trip mates.
descriptionHTML:
The best app to plan a trip, Wanderlog is the easiest-to-use, completely free travel app for planning every kind of trip, including road trips and group travel! Create a trip itinerary, organize flight, hotel, and car reservations, view places to visit on a map, and collaborate with friends. After your trip, share a travel guide to inspire other travelers.

‚úàÔ∏èüõèÔ∏è See flights, hotels, and attractions in one place (like TripIt and Tripcase)
üó∫Ô∏è View road trip plans on a travel map & map your route (like Roadtrippers)
üñáÔ∏è Rearrange the order of places easily by drag-and-drop

summary: Map & organize your road trip and travel itinerary: TripIt, Roadtrippers in 1

scraped_reviews.content: We put links/email attachments for flights & hotels/airbnb in this easy to use app. Also, we added the websites, restaurants etc we were interested in allowing us to quickly review our options when in our new location asking ourselves, "OK, what next?" Only thing keeping this from being 5 star is the fact that the app was not always stable on my android device. Many times the scrolled location would initially hop around and would not settle for a few moments. Would like to see it more stable.

Warning, this is not a free app! Upon opening this app for the first time I was met with a cacophony of pop-ups and suggestions, to the point that I couldn't even use it. it required a login, and when I finally clicked through everything it said I had a 7-Day free trial and then would be charged. I then went to cancel my account, and it says it would take a week to delete. There's no reason it should take a week to cancel an account. If I get charged because of this, I will be disputing.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Beth! I'm Peter, CTO of Wanderlog. Sorry about the confusion - Wanderlog is free, but you can subscribe for advanced features like exporting to Google Maps. To skip the subscribe screen, just tap on the X to the top-left of the page: see https://tinyurl.com/skipsubscribe for more. Does that work? Email me at peterxu@wanderlog.com for more help.

scraped_reviews.content: I really like Wanderlog, and I've found it quite useful even though I only have the free version. So far, I've used it for multiple day vacation trips, single day trips, and even for organizing errands/ local tasks. I really like how you can add a place and it brings up some information about it and even a website if it is available.

I love using this app to plan small trips and large vacations. Everything's fairly user friendly and easy to customize and sort. Sometimes the app is sluggish and I can't get any maps to open or locations to load, which stops me from using the app altogether at that particular moment. Overall, this is my go-to vacation planner!

5/30/25: Up to 5 ‚≠êÔ∏è. Cruise added to itinerary, help request was quick, flight notifications faster than Delta. 11/24/24: I'm really enjoying this app so far. I love the auto-fill day feature and the route optimization. I'm still in the trial period, but I can see this being worth the $40/year for me. I've been doing some last-minute weekend trips that I don't have time to plan my own itinerary for. The one thing I would like to see added is the ability to add cruise ships as a lodging option.

I used the free version to plan my trip. When I added an activity to the itinerary, it would show me the distance between it and the last location. That was so helpful for organizing things into the best order. I kept track of expenses and stayed within budget. I was really impressed with the search functions. You can just search for nearby activities and restaurants without having to leave the app. I highly recommend using this app to plan vacations!

Great planning tool! The divisions for accommodations, transport & itinerary make it easy to organize & retrieve information. I particularly like the way that attractions, restaurants, etc. come up in the itinerary (along with the distance & directions) with the opportunity to add times, cost and even notes. I also appreciate the option to add documents to keep all of the planning in one easy place. I have used other planning tools that are not nearly as functional as Wanderlog!

This app is almost perfect for big trips. Would definitely recommend, but there are 2 things I'd like to see: 1 - The name of whoever posted a note in the overview. It would help with visual clutter. 2 - All our flights are in the app, but everyone is flying from different locations, so there's 10+ flights that aren't associated with any specific person. I would love to be able to attach a tripmate to a flight, or even be able to filter/search by person.

So far the best application I have seen for tracking your trips, itinerary, excursions, places to go or visit, cost management and sharing. And this is just the free version, the paid version has even more features that you can also take advantage. The easy way to add all your flights, hotels, and everything else that has a confirmation number is so good and easy that it is making all my trips look effortless. If you are traveling with family or alone I strongly recommend this app.

This app is great!! Features I love: It links Google maps to the location so I can easily see what's on my schedule and then navigate there. I try to walk. It pulls reservations from my email and automatically enters them. (You have to approve this, it's not automatic - no privacy issues.) It's physically attractive and includes photos of the locations, so it's nice to look at. It has suggestions of things to do in the area. I LOVE that I can use it on the phone and computer.

I like this app. But there are some issues that need resolved. The first is having the program default to connect way points on the map. Currently it doesn't, so when you open the map it appears as an unconnected series of waypoints. This seems easy enough. I tried to download the trip to Google Maps and, even if I had turned on the route, it didn't appear on the Google Map. So, I had to keep the Wanderlog App running on my phone and watch it to stay on route. Not convenient.

I loved having all of our information in one place! We were able to add flight and hotel reservations, tickets for events and most of them were automatically added in from emails. It was really easy! The only downside was the map. I liked that we could see everything on the map, but when I i wanted to view something specific on the map, only certain other items would show up. I wanted to be able to select one but then also see where it was in comparison to our other items.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Debbie! I'm Harry - sorry about the problems with map markers. We just released an update that fixes this. Can you try updating to the app version 2.162 and see if that fixes it?

scraped_reviews.content: I have never planned a vacation, but I decided to plan my upcoming one since I have so much I want to do. This app is AWESOME! It's so easy to use, you can add anything and move stuff around very easily. It incorporates a search engine and a map that allows you to find activities or food and adds it to the day you choose. You can upload your plane tickets hotels car rentals... the list goes on and on really. Highly recommend, you won't regret the paid version either, just saying...

I've always used Tripit but got frustrated trying to add details for an upcoming trip. I went looking for an alternative & found Wander Log. So far I really like it, though adding airbnbs could be better. Other than that, I find it easy to use, has great organization & the ability to hide info you aren't looking at which keeps the clutter down. The Pro version would probably be fantastic but I don't travel enough to justify it. Looking forward to using it on my upcoming 3 country trip!

Great app for traveling! I was able to save points of interest, link to Google maps, travel reviews, and add my own notes to quickly identify specifics about saved places. we were also able to link to our airline, which sent notifications about check-in and boarding. As with all apps, there were a few gliches but nothing to keep me from using. Definitely recommend it.

This has got to be the best app on my phone. It's so useful. I've recommended it to all my friends and family. I love how it keeps all my confirmations for flights, hotels, and other transport in one place. I do wish that adding activities was a little easier (right now you add the place and attach the activity you booked). I'd also love to see the "auto arrange" feature take into account visit times I marked on my stops, so things get better ordered.

I love this app! I'm that person who is the planner of the group and always has a Google Sheet. I LOVE the organization/the mapping functionality of this app & the ability to have different "layers" of the map so I can see locations for different days or purposes (a map showing me everything I want to do! or a map showing me all the restaurants I'm considering! So helpful). Also love emailing the app to auto populate hotel reservations and train/flight reservations onto the itinerary!!

easy and intuitive way to track trip details and itinerary. see itinerary on a map. save a list of ideas for activities and restaurants (before formally adding to itinerary). track expenses to stay on budget. import flight, hotel, car rental details by forwarding confirmation emails into the app... it does the work for you...so easy! I travel a lot and I have used for my 3 trips this summer. highly recommend!

I absolutely love this app!!! I would recommend to anyone who is seriously planning a trip. It will take you through there entire process with ease and all the features you would ever need. The pro version has some features that would be nice to have, especially during the trip itself, but none of it is absolutely necessary. My only criticism is of the pro payment options. You can only buy an annual subscription, and no monthly options exist. Even a 3 month/semi annual sub would be nice.

Do NOT upgrade to the "Pro" version. The free version, on a desktop works very well to organize a trip and consolidate all your travel info in one place. The Android app is extremely slow and buggy. The only supposed advantage of the paid "pro" version ($50/year) is the ability to upload attachments and access your itinerary offline, which does NOT work. My advice is to use the free version to plan the trip, and do not pay to upgrade. I sincerely regret recommending this app to several friends.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Eduardo! I‚Äôm sorry about the app's slowness - we have been improving it. What were you doing that felt slow? I‚Äôm sorry that you didn‚Äôt find Wanderlog Pro useful enough. Just so we can better help you, can you send us a screenshot or a video of what you‚Äôre trying along with a link to your trip? Email me at harry@wanderlog.com for more help.

scraped_reviews.content: I really love how this app organizes all your details. Especially love the feature where you email your reservations, and it plugs it into your iteniary! I attached screenshot of park passes, entered addresses, and it offers up other places to go and see. With a family of 7, I have to stay on top of every detail and reservation: Wanderlog makes that so easy!

Great tool for collecting travel ideas and details in one place! I've just started using Wanderlog as I have 4 different leisure trips coming up in the next few months, each with various friends. Sharing and allowing other contributors is very easy. The recommendations are often things we may have otherwise overlooked. I like that it also allows entry of pricing information and who has paid for it (a pay "day of" option or "unpaid" generic tag would be nice). The itinerary keeps all informed.

So far it's a great app for planning a trip. Holds all the info in one place; flights info, hotels, events. You can see info by category or by day. You can forward your confirmation emails and it will extract the info and add it to your itinerary. One feature I find very useful is the map. It will pin where you're staying and also all your events. This makes it super easy to find places to eat, attractions and planning yoir route and rides.

This is everything I needed in a trip-planning app. Everything is in one place - lodging, restaurants, destinations. I can put notes to write out little schedule details like when I plan to put my son down for a nap. Each destination you set up automatically puts in a link to that place's website, their hours of operation, travel distance from you place of lodging and more. The app is easy to use and so so helpful.

I started using Wanderlog in 2023 to plan my Tokyo trip. From then on, I have not used any other trip planners. Wanderlog is easy to use and I like it that there are many fun recommended sights/places for the countries I travel to. I also love the Optimize Route feature as it helps me plan the itinerary more efficiently. In addition, the Customer Support was very prompt in answering my questions. Overall a great travel app!

I usually plan our adventures in a little notebook, writing everything down old school. Flights, cars, hotels, destinations and points of interest, need to know tips, etc. Wanderlog puts alllll the things on one easy to use platform. The UI is intuitive and easy to navigate, allowing access to needed information from multiple points. You can attach emails with confirmation numbers and it even pulls that info out for you (confirmation, dates, cost, etc) Love it!

Just returned from a 32-day international trip, moving around cities and countries. Every detail was either uploaded to entered into the Wanderlog app and it was so easy! My husband, who is not technical, was able to find all the answers he needed. I didn't have to print itineraries, I added new appointments along the way, and loved the format. Use it once and you'll be hooked!

I love how you can enter the operating hours snd cost to help you budget. I also love that you can add your own notes for each destination if needed. I put the amount of time needed to stay at each destination to help me plan. And I entered closed dates so I don't accidently plan it on the wrong day. After entering your destination, the app conveniently adds destination website and hours if available and more!

Wanderlog is a great trip planner app that allows you to email trip itineraries from your flights, hotels, and rental cars for inclusion on your log. Unfortunately, it doesn't know how to receive information from AirBnB. You can drag and move items for your day, and it utilizes good maps to look up places. I appreciate that the app is accessible by browser, so you can use your laptop or desktop to view and update your Wanderlog. It's such an excellent tool for planning.

Great experience so far. Planning 3 trips this year with the app. I love having everything in one location. I plan early... by the time my trip comes, sometimes I forget where certain documents are, and I have to dig up all my travel info from emails, etc. The app automatically pulls reservations / bookings from my email into each trip itinerary.

It's easy and very handy. It's great for planning a trip while also sharing the expenses with others. It performs a variety of useful calculations for you in terms of the shared expenses. But it's also an extremely useful app for planning and managing your itinerary. I highly recommend Wanderlog, especially if you're sharing expenses with anyone.

Near perfect. PROS: Easy to learn and use. Integration with google is great and I used it alot. Can upload my hotel and air accommodation and send a link to family who needed to know where I was. I would type more, but am limited to 500 characters. CONS: Wish I could check off activities as I did them to keep track (handy for restaurants as well). Wish there was an option to move everything to another day at once (like if your flight gets delayed).

This app is handy, and with a bit of patience can work admirably. I will try it again. It probably would be useful to provide explicit details on the pricing before one opts into subscription. I realize many might be tempted just to click to subscribe, but a good app which has long term ambition should instead focus on bringing in the discerning customers into its subscription base. A good start for a travel app, overall.

Takes time to learn how to use it efficiently. I wish there was a bit more tutorials on how the shortcuts worked. Some days it worked better than others. I liked the "add a place to visit" and the available information it gave me like dates and times of opening, websites, phone numbers, directions, etc., just a click away. Works better on a computer, but ok on the phone for reference.

There are many faulty features in this app, I couldn't delete my account. It didn't parse 90% of my confirmation emails. The reason I would use an app like this is to have organized access to trip details like plane/train/hotel/dinner reservations, confirmations, addresses, etc, items that are tedious to hunt down and record in one place. I was excited for the email feature but it didnt import anything except my Expedia emails. It would be more useful if it could read emails from other companies
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Tia: this is Peter, CTO of Wanderlog; I'm sorry to hear you ran into issues getting your confirmation emails parsed. We're working on getting it to support more emails, but I'd love to look into this more and see which confirmation emails from other sites might not have worked. Can you email me at peter@wanderlog.com? I'd love to help!

scraped_reviews.content: This is one of the most useful and productive applications that I have used and that's coming from an IT professional. It lets me import all my airfare, lodging including Airbnb, train, and car rentals and all I have to do is start choosing the places I want to visit each day. I'm traveling to Spain for 15 days and staying in 7 different locations. Wanderlog allows me to plan the entire trip plus it gives the the ability to get directions from one place to another with a simple click of a link.

Wanderlog is the BEST travel tool I have ever had. my husband and I just got back from a month-long trip to Europe. I was able to add all our tickets to each activity in our itinerary to access instantly. It was helpful to move activities to different days and save things for next time. Wamderlog has made travel so much easier! I'm planning a new trip now and I'm learning all about new cities through suggestions. I highly recommend Wanderlog. Pro is worth every penny! Happy travels!

I am giving the app another go and it does a number of things well, but still has a few oddities. -when sharing as view only you cant share the itinery? thats the only thing i want to share. - it would be nice to specifically exclude (or include) expenses when sharing. - several of the emails for reservations i tried sending were not able to be parsed. - manual entry could use more granular level control. - i would like to be able to add multiple attachments to reservations and activities.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey Johnny! I'm sorry about dark mode being a Pro feature -- I personally use Android in dark mode too! Most of Wanderlog's core trip planning features are free. Dark mode took us a fair bit of work to implement, and we want to ensure Wanderlog's a sustainable business; email me at harry@wanderlog.com, and I'd love to see how I can help.

scraped_reviews.content: There is an issue clicking maybe later on the invites section of creating a new trip. After an engineer from the team reached out for further help and feedback I discovered the trips were being created even though it kept giving an error every time I clicked maybe later. My rating now is 5 stars based solely on the customer service. They were incredibly kind and genuine about the concern over it not working. I don't know yet if the app works for me, but I'm willing to give it a chance at least.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Kit! I‚Äôm Peter, one of the co-founders; I‚Äôm sorry that you had trouble with Wanderlog ‚Äì the app shouldn't not let you do anything just because you didn't invite trip mates. I'd like to take a closer look into this for you. Feel free to email me at peter@wanderlog.com - I‚Äôm an engineer and will try to help out!

scraped_reviews.content: Wanderlog was such a great tool to plan and execute my multi-city, multi-country trip! I forwarded all my booking emails to my trip account, added points of interest, searched for ideas and planned my itinerary with ease. Each day, it was so easy to click on the itinerary and figure out where we were going, and all my reference numbers for rental cars, planes, trains and busses were in 1 place. It is truly is a seamless app that saved us lots of stress trying to figure out the day to day details

So far, it's been not nearly as useful as the free version of Tripit and I've automatically charged $50 for the next year (I miscalculated the free trial by a single day). Not off to a good start. Charging annually is questionable at best, and it's certainly not worth $50. May be worth considering for $30, or if you travel throughout the year consistently.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Erica - I'm Harry, co-founder of Wanderlog. I‚Äôm sorry you had a bad time with our Pro pricing. We're a small team and depend on subscriptions to fund app improvements. We've made our core features (adding places, flights, budgeting, and packing lists) free! What were you trying to do that you couldn‚Äôt? Email me at harry@wanderlog.com for more.

scraped_reviews.content: Wanderlog allows a comprehensive scheduling experience. I'm able to add places to multiple lists then add each item to different days in the itinerary. I can invite my friends to the plan- & choose who can make changes. Also, when I add a place I can add the cost in any currency I desire, split that payment between whoever I need to, & the total is tallied in my native currency. I also like the "explore" option to get ideas for more activities in the area I'm visiting.

Very helpful app if you are a stickler for having a planned itinerary like I am! I usually have to use pen and paper or use an itinerary template when I go on vacation but no more! The app breaks down everything you need to do from the moment you step off of your plane (or out of car etc) , down to hotel, &everything you have planned to do , day by day. It even imports confirmation numbers from ur email so you can access all in one place! no more scrambling to find everything. I love this !

I tried a few commonly suggested itinerary apps before landing on Wanderlog. They have just about every feature you could want; I often found myself hoping a feature existed before checking & it would turn out to be already implemented! Understandably, a few are locked behind a subscription. I'm considering upgrading to Pro to support the team, but it's hard to justify because I only take such trips once a year. If there were monthly subscriptions, I'd seriously consider it! You guys rock!!

I was looking for an app that could help me with making a detailed itinerary with geolocations, and this one hit that description right on the nail. It went one step further with the reservations import from the email account. Another neat feature is small descriptions from the internet about places you put in your itinerary. Made things so much easier and intuitive for me. Would use it for every trip I take henceforth!

The app is GREAT! Me and my fianc√© used it and were able to completely organize our trip with everything we wanted. Even specific things that required more customization. It honestly offers a lot without premium. If we traveled more, I could see myself buying premium. My only complaints are that I wish you could simplify the page more and hide more tabs so it improves readability and the other problem is that it can slow down and freeze when you do a lot like open maps and stuff.

Best itinerary planner for traveling! Love that I can use it on my desktop and phone and they will sync seamlessly. Adding places and notes were easy. Love the diff tabs for Overview, Itinerary, and Expenses. Telling me the distance and time between each location, and opening up Google Maps for directions is so helpful. The only hiccup I've had was sometimes rearranging the places on my phone and the scrolling went crazy, but it works, just requires a couple tries and some patience with it.

Easy to use, I've never been so organized for a vacation before. My favorite part was that I could just add all the events/places I was interested for my vacation destination, and then I could view them all on a map to organize by day. And the itinerary shows the travel time from one activity/hotel to the next. The only thing I can think of for improvement..... I tried to print out the itinerary, but apparently it's only an option when logged in from a PC. And I couldn't get that to work.

This was a cool way to think out and plan our trip so that everything was saved in one place and was accessible via the app during our trip. All of the destinations both large and small were included when I searched, which was a surprise given some of the "hidden gems" I searched for. I loved the layout and the way I could easily shift things around as our plan developed.

I rarely leave reviews, but so far, I'm very impressed. This is a really good app that consolidates all my travel reservations in one place. Airline, rental car, hotel, agenda, itinerary, activities, etc. It is so easy to import all of these loose ends by simply forwarding the confirmation emails to my profile. I did have to QC the details and make a correction, but it was all entered into my trip data, so even that was pretty simple. Great job with this. I plan to use it for all my trips.

title: ReadEra ‚Äì book reader pdf epub
description: ReadEra ‚Äî book reader allows reading books for free, offline in PDF, EPUB, Microsoft Word (DOC, DOCX, RTF), Kindle (MOBI, AZW3), DJVU, FB2, TXT, ODT and CHM formats. No ads Read books without ads. The ReadEra program for reading books and viewing PDF documents neither contains ads nor imposes internal purchases. No register We‚Äôve made a fast, reliable reader app that doesn't compel users to use any specific services. The book reader works offline and is entirely free. Read books for free without limits! Read books of all formats ReadEra is a set of reading apps in one app, which reads well multiple types of formats: book Epub, Kindle (MOBI, AZW3), Fb2; business PDF, Djvu; office Microsoft Word (DOC, DOCX, RTF), ODT; text TXT and others. Reading books, viewing Microsoft Word documents and PDF files from zip archives. The book reader combines in it all advantages of different reading apps. PDF reader ‚Äì margin cropping for pdf files in pdf viewer. The single-column mode will split a double-page spread image from a scanned pdf book into two separate pages. Opens large pdf documents. EPUB reader & MOBI reader reveals all advantages of the EPUB and MOBI formats for eBooks. WORD reader forms contents of a book by titles. FB2 reader opens books of fb2 format from zip archive; no need to unpack. The reader for books, ReadEra, reads all popular formats of books, journals, articles and other documents in one app. Best book manager for your library Auto-detection of books and documents. Just download an Epub book, PDF journal, Microsoft Word documents or PDF article from the Internet so they appear in the reader for reading. Easy navigation through folders and downloads. Grouping books by authors and series. Book reading lists: To Read, Have Read, Favorites. The Collections tool (bookshelves) allows creating personal thematic collections. Books and documents can be added to one or several collections at the same time. We do our best to ensure order in your eBook library. Navigation through a book Quick access to the reading settings, table of contents, bookmarks, text highlights, quotes, notes, page browsing history in a book and other eBook options. Navigate the book using the page pointer or the progress line. Footnote texts in Epub, Mobi, Docx, Fb2 formats are printed at the bottom of the page, as in a paper book. Displays the total number of pages of a book and separately pages of a reading chapter. Convenient reading settings Auto-saving the current reading page. Nice color modes while reading books: day, night, sepia, console. Horizontal or vertical page flipping mode. Screen orientation, brightness and page margins adjustment, including PDF and DjVu. Adjustable type font, size, boldness, line spacing and hyphenation for Microsoft Word, Epub, Kindle (Mobi, Azw3), Fb2, TXT and ODT. Zoom option for PDF file and Djvu file when you read PDF and read Djvu. Economized memory usage The reader doesn‚Äôt copy books and documents into its store; detects duplicate files, saves bookmarks and the current reading page, even when files are moved or deleted. For example, even if you delete files and download books again, you‚Äôll be able to continue reading books from the last read page. EBook ReadEra allows storing data on the SD card. Multi-document mode The book reader Readera allows reading several books and documents at the same time. For example, you can simultaneously read Epub books and PDF journals by placing them on the device screen in split-screen mode (two windows). Or read Microsoft Word, ODT, PDF documents, Epub/Mobi and Kindle books, switching between them by the "Active apps" system button. EBook reader ReadEra ‚Äì best app for reading PDF, Epub, Kindle (Mobi, Azw3), TXT, Fb2 books; Microsoft Word (DOC, DOCX, RTF), ODT documents and PDF viewer for Android. Read books easily and for free with ReadEra!
