summary: Read books PDF, EPUB, WORD, KINDLE, MOBI! Your ebook reader among reading apps.

scraped_reviews.content: I really enjoyed using this app and have moved to the premium version. I enjoy reading but whenever I wanted to get busy, I'd just switch to listening until I could go back to reading. I switched to premium because I wanted to be able to do other things with my phone while listening and though they're AI voices doing the reading, they're frankly doing a better job than many narrators out there, lol. So, yes, I recommend and am happy with my premium purchase too.

I really enjoy this AI Audio reader. I like to read and listen to my books but I can't always afford the audible. This is an awesome Plan B. I immediately purchased the premium option without question. Premium is a one-time charge and it's under $15. You have lots of AI voices that you can choose from. Including Australian, United Kingdom, English and more. I highly recommend this app for people that like things read to them; for whatever reason!

The best. Phenomenal - Simple and effective and the TTS Text To Speech gives you audiobook approach, even for the free level. No nags, and nothing you don't need. I've tried a bunch and for ePub, this is what I always use to read on both phone and tablet. Honestly, I didn't even like reading on my phone until ReadEra. It even has the ability to select text and send to Google translate for those wanting to learn to read new languages! Super thoughtful design. Highest Kudos.

I have used this app for many years with no issues. Now over the last month or so every time my document is loaded it takes like 5 minutes. It used to take like 30 seconds. I don't know what happened to this but the documents are already on my phone it should not take so long to load. I got a new phone and the issues stopped so it appears the app will slow down on older phones as no amount of updates ever helped speed it up until I got a new phone.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Update the app to the latest version. Please email us with more details if this doesn't help. Thank you

scraped_reviews.content: I love it, it has some down sides to it, cant zoom on the double spread, u can increase the font size through the menu, but that's a hassle. some pdfs it doesn't read or turn them into a weird washed out version of them, sometimes images, that appear fine on other apps are completely pixelated, of low quality on this one. some books if you mark text to quote, it jamms all the letter together when u read it after. limited amount of fonts, doesn't support pretty ebook formatting, that's a shame

Very handy! I read a lot of fanfiction all at once and keeping tabs open slows my phone, so this has been a godsend! love the fact I can also delete files from the app itself which makes downloading updates easier since I don't have to dig through my downloads to get rid of the old one, thus saving having multiple of the same file in storage. The collections option is also great for when I have the odd receipt pdf so i can sort thise out of regular reading. :)

The app is good but for one thing. It reads the page numbers and text in headers/footers at the end of every page. This is awfully distracting, especially when trying to read text that is already difficult to follow. I find it very distracting to hear the random text in the middle of a paragraph. There should be an option to choose what text should and should not be read aloud, particularly for those reading textbooks that have a lot of this running text.

ReadEra (& Premium) is the BEST ebook app I've ever used. I bought the premium app just days after installing this one! It is amazing! It has NO ads, (even the free version) it reads most doc types, it has a built-in Kids' lock mode, and more. It is the best ebook app that I have found. Before I found ReadEra, I used Adobe Acrobat, but their paid version is ridiculously expensive, and you can do virtually nothing except open docs in the free version. I deleted Adobe, and now use ReadEra instead.

This is a great reader for my purposes. It's maybe not one of the most fleshed out readers out there, but for being free and having NO ADS (a rarity for apps these days), it's fantastic. If you have the money, I'd say support them and buy the premium version; I know I will once I've got some extra money to spend. They deserve it for making the free version as accessible as it is.

Better than I expected, there's a lot of worthless apps on here advertising different than what they give, but this one is as it says on the tin. Keeps your place when you leave the app, stores the file exactly as it comes, and is very customizable. I didn't change the font or background, but I'm sure the feature is a great addition for people who struggle reading under certain conditions.

While the features may feel "barebones" to some, it's exactly what I'm looking for. I want an app that can open my files, from various locations, with some amount of visual and functional customization and that can keep track of where I am Within the file. I do wish opening images to zoom in were a little less cumbersome; tapping, zooming, and the closing the image feels clunky in comparison to the rest of the app. That Aside, ReadEra is a wonderful app. Simple and effective and all without ads.

does exactly what I want it to. opens a wide range of book formats, memorizes the spots in the books, easy page tracking, has multiple page formats, it's just an all around good app for anybody who wants to read books. Later update: It's gotten some adjustments for QoL. It's actually better than it was when i downloaded it, so kudos for making improvements on what was already a good app. Even further in the future: even more QoL changes. Still 0 complaints.

I've been using this app for several years, and it's hands down the best I've found. It keeps track of what you're reading and where you left off. It supports full-text search and gives you access to a table of contents (from anywhere in the document) if the PDF you're reading supports it. And the free edition isn't polluted with ads (just has a couple limited features compared to the paid version).

Very good for reading all kinds of documents. Chm docs have weird formatting, but are otherwise readable. It is the best reader, by far, that I was able to find about 4 years ago, and I have been using it since. I have not used many features, but have not noticed a bug yet. Fantastic job to the developers! Update: The back button, after selecting a link in a PDF, does not work anymore.

I love to read! I spend any free time reading and everyone needs a habit, reading is mine. As I've gotten older, late 50's'ish, I have found that I can still read and hear what I'm seeing or just listen. I've spead up the audio and can read faster now. On the flip-side, the voices don't change from character to character and it pronounces words wrong at times.

Great for what this app capable of. I mean not overwhelming but useful. All the option and functions are minimal and easy to use. And those are helpful also. No worries reading any of the formats. Basically it solves every problem. But if you consider to edit files then it's not the match. It's for reading only and it's best in it.

it's my go to for all my ebook downloads. I wasnt crazy about it at first. I was still using my overdrive APK. ended up having to use this for a PDF I was wanting to read and the more I used it the more I liked it. tons of settings with ez interface. I like the A.I. reader on this better than speechify. both the free versions anyway. this has many more voices and dialects. they aren't as good as the paid ones. but they sound close to having inflections and speech patterns. Speechify s free areü§ñ

I wish that there were more free options, at very least allowing the lock screen while audio is reading. only real complaint is the fact that it will stop reading after a certain amount of time and you cannot start a book, and it will read it all the way to the end.... also you can't avoid it reading credits on the bottom of pages when it's reading to you, needs an option to avoid certain different parts like headers, citations, and page number in the middle of sentences especially page to page

every time when I open a file from a USB drive, Readera creates a copy of it in the Download folder on the internal storage. Readera shows "downloading file" before it opens it. it's very annoying because then I have to remember to clean up the internal storage. EVERY TIME. I also cannot add any USB folders to the list of folders in Readera.

Freakin awesome, I keep all my books on readera. PDFs, text files, etc all look great automatically upon opening in terms of formatting. Sometimes the buttons get a little "sticky" (ex. after closing the app while reading and then reopening it, I cant always open the settings menu by tapping on the page I have to close the book and open it again) but that's easily worked around. Night, night contrast, and day settings fit every reading environment's light level so it's always comfortable.

I enjoy using this app. The interface is user-friendly, and the app is equipped with amazing features. However, I would have loved if you could improve the "Sepia contrast" colour mode to also display true pictures colour like that of "twilight" colour mode. Thank you.

I've been using this for two years now;best reading app ever. But, I wish it kept streaks (maybe this is the effect of too much Duolingo on meüåöüòÇ) or something fun. Like reading analysis at the end of the month or year, you could also create reading goals? I think I would give it 6stars then‚ÄîüòÇ how will I get the extra star? Add the features and see!

Three years of using ReadEra. Great layout, easy to navigate, and ad-free, which is a huge plus. But there could be more customization options‚Äî it's dull having a select group of colors and fonts. And the app seems to be able to process a limited range of file formats‚Äî EPUB, PDF, and AZW3. One thing I'd love is the option to change the image of a file, in the same way you can edit the name and annotation. Well-deserved 4/5.

This reader is soo great! I've been using it to download books and have them read to me while I drive and the voice is actually pretty good, I was expecting something off-putting and was happily surprised when it wasn't too robotic. The lack of ad banners/pop-ups is great too.

Absolutely excellent app, have been using it for years, recently bought the premium version. It has plenty different ways of cataloguing and filing, as well as the option to have the documents read aloud. I love that function and use it all the time. All in all, great app. 0 ads too

This app is a lot more visually appealing to me than others. Even if it's not as feature rich as Moon+ or Librera, the user interface is simple to grasp. However, it could benefit with a Reading Ruler like in the Kindle or Moon+ apps. It's a neat accessibility function for dyslexics but would help anyone to read easier without getting lost. It would pair well with ReadEra's continuous scrolling mode. Would love to see this in the future! :)

Simple and good looking interface, easy-to-use, and works for all file formats (that I know of). You can open any book where you left off or from your set bookmarks. The only slight issue I have is that the Reading Now page also holds books set yet to start or completed too. I think this would be better off in an "All" page while the reading now is reserved for those in progress to have a more accurate view of your library. Overall great app though fulfills all the basic needs.

really disappointed. you used to be cool. I use to use your app for reading my school books the speaker and voice was good but now it sounds like my ears are gonna be on fire I get headaches when I listen to it now. I even lost my 3 years of bookmarks, quotes, highlights thinking reinstalling would help with the speaker but I was so wrong. please please fix the speaker and the voice . it's like needle static .but you helped me before so thanks and I am really really sad.

I love that this reader has the opendsylexic font, and zi can read longer without having to double check and go back a few paragraphs again because I see to have read some of the words wrong. The variety in brightness is also great for me. Also, I love that the settings aren't that touch sensitive. My previous reader used to bring up the reading bar all the time and I hate the reading bar, I don't want it. So I'm gonna stick to this one now.

it's pretty good, but it would be great if there was some reliable way of getting to the document's index, or even just exiting from the document you are currently reading without pressing the phone's side button, then unlocking the screen, then closing all apps. As a screenreader it's so good - clear, no disruptive ads, easy to page through the document, that it's a shame it's so technically difficult to use for longer documents, especially novel-length epubs. thanks!

Very good and smooth zooming in and out when viewing the pdf (although could be smoother / higher fps). And please make it possible to move around the screen while also zooming in with two fingers like some other apps. Because right now you can only zoom in and then move around. Not both at once.

This is by far the coolest app I've had in a while. It allows you tl organise books and place them into collections so they're easier to find. You can open multiple documents all at once in different windows allowing you to access all the documents without having to close your current window to reopen another document. As a student,this is the best, as it makes the process of studying more faster,as I can switch between 1 document (maybe a question paper),and another(the memorandum)

my experience with it is great. I love that it has an option for the book to be read for you. I'm able to complete tasks and still learn about the books I want. I did notice that there's a different narrator o. different brands. I experienced a difficult time understanding the narration on one brand compared to another. besides that, I love everything about it

Incredibly simple to use, with so many customizable options for your files. Absolutely no ads, no extra unnecessary stuff, just an ereader library for yourself that's accessible. Allows me to read my favourite things without nausea from scrolling and let me get back to one of my most passionate hobbies. Highly recommended!

i have being using this for more than one year now for both large files (books) and small 1 page documents, and i am very happy wirh it. simple, easy to use, works like a charm, never had any issue. an app with true intelligence that does not try to do things for you but rather lets you easily do what you need.

Been using it for close to seven years. Has never given me trouble and it has done more than enough as a free book app for my needs that I see purchasing the lifetime premium version very soon. Maybe the UI could be polished more to act as the cherry on top of a an already good product. One thing that I'll suggest, is making the movement of data more easier between devices. I successfully recovered my progress on books and documents as well as the annotations and quotes, but it was a pain.

I think it is one of the best app to personally read PDFs and EPUBs on my phone with a good variety of background themes and optional adjustments. And also it let you know which page you are at, how much percent have you read it, whether you ahve finished it or not... Eventually there is no other reading app for me which came close to this one. Personally, I haven't found anything for it to be improved

Very convenient reader, has means to remember unfamiliar words in a built-in notepad, or send them to Google translate. Does not eat up screen space by posing large margins, font size is configurable, as well as a lot of other settings. I've read "Horus Rising", "False Gods", and "Galaxy in Flames", and have enjoyed them greatly, all on an average Android phone screen, without any discomfort whatsoever, despite that my eyesight is far from perfect. Thank you, great job!

It's a very good app, especially for free! There are no ads to upgrade to paid service, + it does everything I want from a reading app. I'd love to give it 5 stars, but can't, because it's very difficult to move from reading to the other functions. I always need to fight with it to get the menus + settings. But maybe that's caused by my aging phone. Until recently the app worked fine 100%, and my phone does mess up a lot lately. Maybe that's the source of the problem.

Best ebook reader I have found so far, and I doubt I will change it‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äçüî• Customizable, reading progress, then there is the memory feature of where you reached last, mind-blowingly cool, PLUS NO ADS, THIS REMAINS THE BEST PART ABOUT THIS APPü§Øüéá, Can the developers add a dictionary so that I don't have to keep switching between two or more apps, especially my phone has this "RAM" thing that restarts an app occasionally after I leave it.

ReadEra is a Kindle-like reading app that works beautifully on both my tablet and phone. I mainly use it for PDFs and EPUBs, and I love its clean, intuitive interface ‚Äî no instructions needed, it just feels natural to use. It‚Äôs perfect for reading learning materials, and I especially appreciate the ability to highlight quotes for later review or sharing. The bottom progress bar is a small but brilliant touch that helps me track my progress in each book. Using ReadEra on my Samsung

Using ReadEra to cover more ground with academic papers. It's really effective and helps with reviewing more text in less time. The downside is that it reads aloud sequentially everything, including headers, side notes, etc. So, you need to keep your eyes on the text almost all the time.

I would just like 1 update. To open the bookmark instead of taking that whole space let us also view alongside what pages it is opening into. Not anything else but just the bookmark. Because it is really not possible to always type why exactly I'm marking that page. I promise to update this to 5 stars üôè nvm, I'm keeping it 5 üåü cz it's really really a good app and u guys don't deserve to be blackmailed

I love this app! Its easy to use, and has really helpful functions to help me sort through my books and my reading lists. The "unread" filter especially, or else my books just pile upüòÖ . I highly recommend it. oh yes, and it has NO ADS!! At all!!

Smooth, no glitches, even the free version has almost all the features one would need. Well integrated with other apps on the device (e.g. dictionaries). Amazon, watch and learn! GooglePlay asks me now to rate the ads, but I haven't seen any.

This app is so easy to use. It's simple, easy to navigate, and keeps all your books, PDFs, etc.. in one place. Search through documents using keywords. The best part is I don't have to remember a password! I like to choose my own level of security. Other apps may offer the same but none of them worked for me. This one does. Two thumbs up.

Love it so far! The app is easy to use. Love the various features to categorise the files/books and the screen color options, that works even with PDF files (it doesn't on iBooks). The free version is useful and doesn't put pressure on you to upgrade. And tho I haven't gotten it (yet), the premium version also seems worth it.

GREAT eReader, but it can't translate emoji's, and I can't see some images. The emoji's are translated into Chinese characters and the images are so small I can't see them or make them bigger. the third issue (more a personal preference than an issue) when set to scroll instead of flipping pages you can still see the page separation lines. there's a bar at the bottom that says what page you're on, so the lines are unnecessary & sometimes throw me out of the story.

Much better than it used to be... but it STILL doesn't allow me to zoom in on epubs... making it totally useless for reading children's books and crafting/DIY manuals... which is why I needed it. And the developers waited a year or more to respond to my last review the last time I tried the app (7 years ago). Guys: responding after more than 3 months makes you look worse than not responding, at all. Free pro-tip ;-)
scraped_reviews.replyContent: In epub format, you can resize images after long touch. There are over 1.5 million reviews here. You should write to the developer at support@readera.org if you want an answer.

scraped_reviews.content: I'd give them 5 stars if they had a light version option for e-ink devices. I use ReadEra in both my phone and my android e-reader and the navigation experience in the latter is completely subpar due to the dark colors, thankfully the reading part works well using the day setting but I really struggle navigating the app to choose the book. I like that I can turn off page animations and some optimizations work well on this device but it needs a light mode, badly.

title: Health Sync
description: Sync your health data from Coros, Diabetes:M, FatSecret (nutrition data), Fitbit, Garmin, Google Fit, Health Connect, MedM Health, Withings, Oura, Polar, Samsung Health, Strava, Suunto and Huawei Health. You can sync to Coros (activity data only), Diabetes:M, Fitbit, Google Fit, Health Connect, Intervals.icu, Samsung Health, Schrittmeister, FatSecret (weight only), Runalyze, Smashrun, Strava, SurvonMD, Suunto (activity data only) or the MapMy apps (MapMyFitness, MapMyRun etc.). Health Connect to Google Drive Sync: Configure an export of health data (steps, heart rate, etc.) as CSV files, and activity data as FIT, TCX, GPX, KML, and CSV files to Google Drive. Automatic Background Sync: Health Sync works automatically and syncs your data in the background. Historical Data Sync: The app starts syncing from your first use. Syncing historical data (data before installation) is available after the free trial. Note: Syncing historical data from Polar is not supported. Caution: Huawei has announced that apps like Health Sync will be restricted from accessing GPS information from Huawei Health if connected after July 31, 2023. However, as of now, this rule is not being enforced, so your activity GPS data will likely continue to sync. Samsung decided in 2020 that no partner app can write steps to Samsung Health anymore. Reading steps data and other data, and writing other data works normally. One week free trial Health Sync is very easy to use. It offers you a one week free trial period. After the trial period, you can make a one-time purchase or start a six-month subscription to continue using Health Sync. For the Withings sync an additional subscription is required. The additional subscription is required due to recurring additional costs that we incur for this integration. Just try the app and see if it fits your needs. What data you can sync depends on the source app from which you sync data, and the destination app(s) to which you sync the data. You can choose different source apps for different types of data. For example: sync activities from Garmin to Samsung Health, and sync sleep from Fitbit to Samsung Health and Google Fit. After the first initialization actions, you can define the different sync directions. Health Sync can sync your Garmin Connect data to other apps, but it cannot sync data from other apps into the Garmin Connect app. Garmin does not allow this. For more information and available workarounds for syncing activity data or weight data to Garmin Connect, please visit the Health Sync website check the FAQ for information about the sync to Garmin Connect. Syncing between health data apps sometimes doesn't work as expected. Don't worry, almost all issues can be solved easily. You can check the Help Center menu in Health Sync. And if you can't solve the issue, you can send a Health Sync problem report (the last option in the Help Center menu), or send an email to info@appyhapps.nl You will get support to solve the sync issue.

Health Sync can sync your Garmin Connect data to other apps, but it cannot sync data from other apps into the Garmin Connect app. Garmin does not allow this. For more information and available workarounds for syncing activity data or weight data to Garmin Connect, please visit the Health Sync website check the FAQ for information about the sync to Garmin Connect.

Syncing between health data apps sometimes doesn't work as expected. Don't worry, almost all issues can be solved easily. You can check the Help Center menu in Health Sync. And if you can't solve the issue, you can send a Health Sync problem report (the last option in the Help Center menu), or send an email to info@appyhapps.nl You will get support to solve the sync issue.
summary: Sync health data between Samsung Health, Strava, Fitbit, Garmin and others

scraped_reviews.content: Functional, but the battery drain was tremendous. Used this to sync Garmin data to Google Fit (my only other health platform, Ultrahuman, already reports to Fit). Seemed to work but Garmin data was slow to sync even though Health Sync was running constantly. What I DID notice, though, was an enormous hit to battery life with Health Sync installed. I'd love for this to be the answer for me, but I need my phone to stay alive more than I need coordinated data.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Darren, thanks for your review comment. Health Sync normally doesn't use a lot of energy, you shouldn't see a significant impact on the phone battery. If you try Health Sync again and the issue happens again, please submit a Health Sync problem report: open the Help Center menu and select the last option: Report another problem.

scraped_reviews.content: Edit: great tech support/CS. They followed up and helped me get it working. But fyi, very difficult on stock Oneplus. So many steps. Currently slowly syncing 2 years history. Will update. Frustrating. I paid for the app. I spent hours trying to get it to work. I just can not sync my Garmin data. I can't even send a support ticket on the app because "something went wrong while sending the problem report." And the app keeps reminding me of this every few minutes...
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Isaac, thanks for your comment. I think there is something on your phone blocking access to our servers. This would also explain the Garmin Connect issue. Do you use a VPN or antivirus app? Please disable, or use mobile data (instead of wifi) then send the problem report. If it still fails, please send an email to info@appyhapps.nl for support.

scraped_reviews.content: I absolutely love this app! About a year and a half ago, my Fitbit stopped automatically syncing with Strava and despite trying literally everything under the sun to fix it, nothing worked. It got to the point where I had to manually upload every single exercise to Strava and that SUCKS. Then I find this app on Reddit and give it a shot and I'm so thankful I did because now my activities are finally automatically syncing from Fitbit to Strava again!!! THANK YOU!!!!! ü•≥ü•≥ü•≥

This app helps weed through all the different issues you hit when trying to use one or more fitness apps. Either you don't have the right tracker or device for the app or the app won't sync with the phone defaults. It's exhausting. Love that I can use one app and sync directionally to the apps I want. No fuss. And if there is an issue, this app walks you through how to fix. Amazing!

If you want to move away from Samsung and hence also Samsung Health, this is the only app that solves the problem of syncing Samsung Health with Google Fit and others. There is an app Health Connect by Google but it does not (in my experience at least) solve the sync. Just have to manage your expectations that the syncing is very slow and not their fault but more due to the different platforms they are dealing with. At this price, it's a no brainer. Save a ton of time. Highly recommended!

I just wanted a way to easily sync to Google Fit so that I can have my data tracked and be able to access it accurately as my Garmin watch displays it. But the data being synced is not accurate. My steps are way off and even after syncing the specific days there is no change. My Garmin watch says a certain amount and this app syncs to my Google fit account and says about half as many. Trial is over so I won't be spending money on something that doesn't work.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Encino, thanks for your updated comment. It is up to you, I can help you solve the problem. If you try again and it doesn't work properly, you can send a problem report: open the Help Center menu in Health Sync and select the last option: Report another problem.

scraped_reviews.content: App stopped syncing with Google Fit a few days ago. This is very frustrating because I track my steps as part of a competition. Health Sync is the 3rd party app to connect the other apps. Didn't I pay for this app??? I tried the work around that was recommended. However, everytime I click on "about Samsung Health," it just opens that section on the settings up.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Thanks for your review. It is sad, but Samsung made a mistake and withdrew all permissions for Health Sync. There is temporal workaround on the site www.appyhapps.nl (red letters).

Update: you can get support by sending an email to info@appyhapps.nl

scraped_reviews.content: Although I paid for this app, it doesn't work as it should. It constantly gives me error messages that my activities couldn't be synced. I've written to the developers - no resolution. I tried reporting the issue through the app as requested and continually received an error stating "problem sending report. Try again". I tried multiple times and gave up. Wouldn't recommend.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Stella, we emailed you on November 16th about this issue. To help, please send a problem report: Help Center > Report another problem. If that fails, then there is an issue (restriction) with the internet connection used by the phone. You can also email us at info@appyhapps.nl, then we can help you solve this issue.

scraped_reviews.content: Subscription Service? Really? If you're not going to advertise that you should just charge for the app. I'd prefer having to watch an add than be "surprised"by a required subscription. For me this app did not work well enough for me to pay for it anyway. I needed to go and allow permissions on a few different occasions during the "trial". Deleted app.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Ashley, thanks for your comment. You can choose between one time purchase or subscription. Some people prefer subscription, others don't. Health Sync can't use ads because it is a background service. In the Play Store description it is mentioned that you have to pay after the one week (!) free trial.

scraped_reviews.content: No longer synchronizes data from Google Fit to Samsung Health. This worked perfectly on my Note 9 at first. Now it give an error everytime it tries to sync. I have tried the suggestion to turn off battery optimization for the app with no success. It seemed to happen after nutrition data was added to the list of data that can be synchronized.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello David. Thanks for your comment. This should work, so if it isn't, please send a Health Sync problem report: open the Help Center menu, choose 'Report another problem' and follow the steps to send the report. You will get support to solve the problem.

scraped_reviews.content: Update: their response has nothing to do with my review. I'm not complaining about historical data transfer, new data won't transfer either. In other words, the app doesn't do anything. Doesn't transfer data between Samsung health and Google fit like it claims it does. And it's only a week long trial, after a few days it starts warning you that you have to pay. For an app that doesn't work anyway.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Jay, sorry that your first comment was misinterpreted. Of course Health Sync should sync the data. If you have an issue, you can use the Help Center, if you can't find the solution, you can use the last option in the Help Center menu: Report another problem.

scraped_reviews.content: TLDR; Works great and fantastic customer support. This app does exactly what I need it to do. I was pointed to this app by a Reddit user. My ultimate goal was to sync my steps from my 'Garmin Forerunner 645 Music' to Google Fit (in order to track my runs for Pokemon Go, without carrying my phone with me). On my initial install, I tried it out with the trial and things worked like they should. The app does a great job of walking you through the setup process (which varies depending on the apps you're syncing.) After my trial was up, I encountered an issue when attempting to purchase the lifetime license of the app, so I reached out to support. Hielko walked me through troubleshooting steps until the issue was resolved and it's now working great. I'd definitely recommend this app to anyone aiming to reliably sync or export health data from sources that otherwise won't allow them to do so.

Not consistent enough to be worth paying any amount of money for. Tried the app out for the free 1 week trial period. Days 1 & 2 I had sync error messages, but after changing some settings in Google Fit, it synced fairly accurately for about 2 days. then started giving error messages again. The free trial period wasn't long enough to figure out if the the app was going to be easy to use or if I could fix it again.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Kate, thanks for your review. If the sync gives errors there is something wrong. The Help Center menu gives some information, but if you can't solve it yourself you can get help by sending a problem report: Help Center menu, choose 'Report another problem'. Or send a message to info@appyhapps.nl for support. Sync issues can be solved.

scraped_reviews.content: Works as advertised. One hour after submitting this excellent review, the app stopped syncing between Google Fit and Samsung Health. I've followed instructions and reset everything but not working anymore. Not sure what happened, but not as pleased as before. Updated review, 8/31/19. 5 stars for the quick response from the developer and a great workaround. Working normally again.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your review. It is sad, but Samsung made a mistake and withdrew all permissions for Health Sync. There is temporal workaround on the site www.appyhapps.nl (red letters).

scraped_reviews.content: I really like this app. It allows you to use multiple apps to keep track of fitness goals, since I have yet to find one app that does everything I want. I would like it if Steps and Exercise could be two completely separate sync categories. I also wish more things would sync both ways, but I suspect that is a weakness in the apps being synchronized rather than a fault of this app.

App is great! Outside of maybe needing a bit more information on what it can and can't do based on other apps limitations, it's very affordable and does exactly what it sets out to do. Their email support was very friendly and straightforward, and got to me right away. The best (and likely only) people offering this valuable service, thank you so much!

Overall, great (have paid version). I like the export feature, esp when bringing up concerns to the doctor, I can hand over my data easily. I like being able to synchronize my fitbit with different fitness apps as well. I just wish it didn't just quietly fail at times. I sometimes don't know there are issues unless I manually go in.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Robin, thanks for your review comment. I'm sorry that there is sometimes a failure. That should not happen. Can you please check when there is again a problem, and submit a problem report on that same day or the next day: open the Help Center menu in Health Sync and select the last option: Report another problem.

scraped_reviews.content: This app has been a technological godsend. When I first got my Samsung Watch and couldn't sync to Google Fit, I had some concerns. Very happy that I found this app and got it installed. Thus far there's only been one problem with the app, and that was when some the data was either doubling up or not syncing at all. Turns out that was due to having a Google Fit option still set to sync. Once I turned that off the app worked like a charm.

The app was working great until today. Now it keeps telling me that I need to update the permissions for Samsung Health. I tried that but it didn't work. Update: I tried uninstalling both Health Sync and Samsung Health. No change. I can't enable anything. All sync options are disabled. Second update: I tried the workaround and it worked perfectly. My app is syncing again. Thanks for your help!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your review. It is sad, but Samsung made a mistake and withdrew all permissions for Health Sync.There is temporal workaround on the site www.appyhapps.nl (red letters).

scraped_reviews.content: I use this app to sync my Garmin data to Google Fit. It worked great on my Samsung Galaxy S8, but since upgrading to the S10, I've had difficulty getting the app to recognize that Garmin Connect is syncing, which means that Health Sync is not capturing the data to push to Google Fit. I have tried disabling all of the battery saving "features" that Samsung utilizes, but still can't seem to get the app to sync the data with any regularity. Just for reference, on my S8, it would sync multiple times throughout the day and everytime I hit the manual sync button in Garmin Connect, but on the S10 it seems the best I can do is about one sync per day, and even that is hit or miss. There is no option to force a manual sync in the Health Sync app if you're using Garmin as the source data, so the fact that it doesn't detect when Garmin is syncing makes the app ineffective. EDIT: Apparently the issue was related to the SmartSwitch when I transferred the apps from my S8 to S10. I was able to resolve the issue by completely uninstalling both apps and starting over from scratch. It's now working as expected. Just FYI - in this case, it had nothing to do with the battery saving settings. Back to 5 stars!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Justin, thanks for your review. Garmin sends update messages to your phone when new data is uploaded to Garmin Connect. Please check the site https://dontkillmyapp.com/samsung for the S9/S10 recommendations and apply these for Health Sync. There must be some configuration that disturbs the background processes.

scraped_reviews.content: Great app! Android/Google/Samsung is a bit of a mess when it comes to fitness & wellness tracking apps. With this I was able to actually have a pretty comprehensive dashboard by syncing sleep, nutrition, work outs, step tracking from multiple sources. It still takes a bit of time to tweak the Health Sync and native sync options from other apps before you can aggregate all the data, but the developer can't do anything. Great job! Idea: create a HSync dashboard because Samsung/Fit's kinda suck.

I paid for the subscription as it sounded like a great idea. But when it tries to sync with Fitbit, it tells me I need to get permission, sends me to Fitbit, I sign in... And it just spins. Hope you can fix this as I think you have a very useful app if it does what it says it will. ** Follow Up: I appreciated the response and ongoing work of customer service which did fix the issue. Good work!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Brian, thanks for your comment. Please send an email to info@appyhapps.nl for support. Maybe you can add a few screenshots to explain the problem. You will get support to solve the issue.

scraped_reviews.content: FINALLY! Something that can sync data from one service to the next so I don't have to wear my smartwatch, a Fitbit, and a tracker for my insurance. It was so annoying because they would always have different numbers which my brain refused to accept and bothered me so much. This app was a godsend! Edit: The dev replied to my review within minutes of me writing it and let me know how to add sync services. The app is amazing but the customer service is better!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Andrew, thanks for your review! You can change a sync direction in the main screen of Health Sync, just click on the green arrow of the sync direction, and select 'Change sync direction'. If you have any other questions, you can contact info@appyhapps.nl for support.

scraped_reviews.content: Was looking for a way to reliably sync my Garmin workouts with Google Fit. I used to use Strava, but there were some activities that it wouldn't add no matter what I tried. Have been using Health Sync for about a month now, and in my experience it hasn't had any issues at all. Definitely recommend buying if you're using a Garmin as your main fitness tracker.

I use this app to sync my Samsung Watch to Google Fit. It was great, easily 5 stars, and I was happy to pay after the trial. But automatic syncing hasn't worked for months now. I have to manually open and refresh both Health Sync and Google Fit when I remember or when I notice syncing is not happening. Sometimes, that doesn't even work. This is annoying because it throws off the weight loss app I sync with Google Fit. Disappointing, because it all used to be seamless. Reduced from 5 to 3 stars.

Works well enough. Will error out from time to time though. And how do you sync more than one thing? Either there's no way to do it, or the UX was bad enough that I couldn't figure it out. Will update if I figure out how and it was my fault though! Edit: Also bought the actual version (one time purchase) and it's still saying "you have x days left on your trial"
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Mark, thanks for your review. If you mean with 'sync more than one thing' that you want to sync from multiple sources, that's not supported yet. Multi source sync for specific data like weight will be added this year (probably in the coming months). If your purchase isn't recognized, please contact info@appyhapps.nl for support.

scraped_reviews.content: Very effective. Could be a bit clearer (it's rather sparse) but a great solution. I use it with Google fit, Samsung health (and watch), Withings body+ scale (and app) and to be fair, it let's them all sync pretty well. Weight, heart rate, workouts, everything you'd expect. Occasionally it sends mysterious warnings but normally that means you just need to prod it to sync again. Happens pretty rarely. Very good app.

The interface could be a little easier to use, but once it's set up, you don't really need to interact with it again. My main gripe is that when you sync to your Google Drive account, it just creates a new folder for each health metric in the Drive root, which is messy. Is much rather have one Health Sync folder with folders for individual metrics inside
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Ashlynn, thanks for your review. In the Google Drive webbrowser, you can create a special folder for the synced data, and then move (not copy) the existing sync folders that Health Sync created to the folder you created. If you need help, please contact info@appyhapps.nl for support.

scraped_reviews.content: I rarely rate apps but wow, Health Sync does exactly what it claims it does! It allowed me to transfer years of running and hiking data when migrating from a Samsung to a Garmin watch, which seemed impossible or at least a longshot since there is no app integration between them (this transfer of data cannot be done directly, but health sync's workaround works perfectly). The only thing I would improve is the documentation, specifically when syncing historic data.

Since Google Fit is unreliable, have to rely on Samsung health which isn't compatible with Lose it! Health Sync to the rescue! Love that. One star off for not being compatible with much else. It's a too long story of all the apps I have to use to get my tracking data for various types of workouts into one desired place. If Health Sync were more broadly compatible, it would simplify my life. (In fairness, if my workout apps were more compatible, I wouldn't need Health Sync!)

Fantastic and useful app to sync from Fit to Samsung Health. However, after the last update, I keep getting Samsung Health Sync Error. I do everything the app says and it never works. Not sure if it's merely a UI bug. Doesn't sync anything anymore. Cleared data and reinstalled, still no go. Something has broken here server side. UPDATE: after workaround, works. thanks. updated rating. love the app hope Samsung fixes this.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your review. It is sad, but Samsung made a mistake and withdrew all permissions for Health Sync. There is temporal workaround on the site www.appyhapps.nl (red letters).

scraped_reviews.content: The idea of the app is good, but the execution seems flawed. I followed the instructions to the letter, yet I am left with duplicates, getting 50 or so readings inserted into my Samsung Health App over the course of 40 minutes (four syncs), even though my watch does not read my pulse that often. Furthermore, comparing the Google Fit data with the Samsung Health data clearly shows that the imports are excessively inaccurate. I was considering buying this until these errors presented themselves.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Nickolai, thanks for your comment. Could you send a problem report: Help Center menu, then 'Report another problem'? And email some concrete examples of your observations to info@appyhapps.nl? The sync doesn't invent data, so I wonder what is happening.

scraped_reviews.content: It's not a bad app. I recently bought a Samsung Gear Watch and I wanted to be able to have stuff on my Google fit. Everywhere recommended this app. It works just like it's supposed too for the most part. (slight issues getting things to go back and forth once when I wanted stuff to go to Samsung Health.) But I think 99¬¢ every 6 months or $2.99 to permanently buy it is way more than the utility it provides.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Jacob, thanks for your review. Changing sync direction is not recommended. The price covers the work for app updates, app maintenance, and support for all kind of issues with Google Fit, Samsung Health and Health Sync. And luckily it is your free choice if you want to pay or not :)

scraped_reviews.content: Integrations aren't easy. Creating a platform that gives customer a choice to push data between two unrelated sources is even harder. Health Sync accomplishes that. The interface is easy to use, the app is very up-front and knowledgeable about any API limitations (like - platform X doesn't allow steps to be pushed from other sources), the sync is idempotent, and support is exceptional. Highly recommend. Using it to sync years of history from Samsung Health to Fitbit.

Edit: I've updated my rating to 5 stars for the fantastic support from the developer and the fact I really do love the app!  Original review below, but as they note Samsung made a change that took away granular permissions control and thus stopped the app from accessing the data even though "All Permissions" was given.  They have helpfully provided the workaround on their site which entails turning on Developer's Mode in Samsung Health. (an option I didn't know existed even!)    --==Original Review:==-- Application did great until i received the August Android security patch this morning, now it won't sync anything. All permissions are granted in Samsung health and reinstalling does not resolve it and allow it to sync again. Again, it worked until the latest Android security update. Samsung Galaxy S8, Android v.9
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your review. It is sad, but Samsung made a mistake and withdrew all permissions for Health Sync.There is temporal workaround on the site www.appyhapps.nl (red letters).

scraped_reviews.content: I absolutely love this app. I only have a few things I'd like to see improved (if possible). 1. Most important: nutritional data syncing from Fitbit to Samsung Health. While calories are syncing, I'm not getting nutritional data synced. 2. If possible, I'd like to see blood pressure sync from My BP Lab 3. I'd love to sync more often than once per 10 minutes. The faster, the better.

No complaints. I like using Samsung Health because it pretty much does everything in one app, but I couldn't figure out how to sync it with my Garmin Vivofit 3 until I found this app. Now everytime my watch syncs with Garmin Connect this app automatically sends the data to Samsung Health for me. I mostly use it to send my steps and walking, but it does also sends other info, like my sleep pattern, too which is pretty cool. It's well worth the purchase price in my opinion.

Followed all the extra instructions for Pixel phones, app will not sync with Fit, Fitbit, or Health Connect, on it's own. I have to open the app, both Garmin and this app, to get anything to sync. And then it's usually partially updated and I have to manually update again. Not very helpful, certainly not worth paying for. I don't understand all the positive reviews unless those people are narcissistically checking their apps. If you like to set it and forget it, this is not the app for you.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Wayne, thanks for your comment. I'm sorry that there is a problem with the automatic sync. I would like to help you solve the problem. Please send a problem report: open the Help Center menu in Health Sync and select the last option: Report another problem.

scraped_reviews.content: Works as advertised I have a Garmin Vivoactive 3 and an Android phone with the LoseIt diet app and Garmin Connect. I also have Google Fit. Garmin Connect syncs with LoseIt well enough on its own but I needed a third party app for Connect to sync with Google Fit. Health Sync does an great job walking you through the steps to do so, with easy to use toggles to set it up. I had no problem purchasing the app for a one time fee. Well designed and easy to use.

Read great reviews so I was hopeful this would be what I needed but less than 24 hours in and I'm not impressed. I use it to sync my Garmin tracker to the Fitbit app. Somewhere along the way, my steps are being added multiple times. Gave me about 5k extra steps yesterday and today is still adding yesterday's, also. Fitbit shows I've taken almost 34k steps today when I'm actually at 1k. Unless this fixes itself it doesn't look like this app is actually going to be what I need.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Karen, thanks for your comment. It looks like you have the MobileTrack enabled in the Fitbit app. Please open the Fitbit app, click on your Fitbit account photo in the top left corner, when you see MobileTrack listed, disable MobileTrack. If this is not the case, please send a problem report: Help Center menu, option 'Report another problem'

scraped_reviews.content: This app would be perfect if it worked perfectly. The auto sync almost never works. After it fails I have to manually press sync then in works. Sometimes, that doesn't even work. I gave an extra star because the developers seem to care and want to help. If the auto works 100% I would give 5 stars To the developers response- I do not have any power saving modes on. I added fit and Sync to a white list for battery utilization. If that works, I'll buy the app and give 5 stars. Thank you.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello James, when the automatic sync doesn't work, then there is some power saving mode or battery optimization active on your phone. Please check the Help Center menu topic 'Automatic sync stops'. If you need more help, please send an email to info@appyhapps.nl

scraped_reviews.content: Easy to get up and running. Smooth sailing until trial ended. Didn't purchase right away, explored alternatives. Health Sync is very basic compared to a competitor which is more my style. That app offered more services, data and customization - unfortunately, some info syncing over to G Fit was inaccurate. Deal breaker. I came back around and purchased Health Sync. It's functional and does what it says. Consistent, accurate and syncs FAST. I know I can trust and depend on it working correctly.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your nice review. I appreciate it. Please send your feedback about possible improvements to info@appyhapps.nl We like to improve the app, although the focus is on sync functionality that adds real value for the users.

scraped_reviews.content: Exceptional work. This app simplifies the ability to move my Garmin Connect information to Samsung Health. Extremely easy to use and very informative when it comes to what you can transfer and what you can't. It will also explain why you can't as well. I paid for the 1 time fee as I will continue using this to send data. Thank you for making such a great and useful app!

A necessary nuisance... Health Sync shouldn't be needed, but it's an indispensable tool when it is needed. My only complaints currently: That I have no idea what the new Health Connect integration actually does (does it mean I no longer have to actually sync my data directly to Fit? I can't find any place explaining the functionality), and also, it makes me reauthorize Fitbit every single day at least once (it's probably not Health Sync's fault, but it sure is annoying).
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Ben, thanks for your review. I'm sorry that there is a problem with the Fitbit authorization. I would like to help you. Can you send a Health Sync problem report: go to Help Center, choose Report another problem.

scraped_reviews.content: This app works really well transferring selected data from one app to one other app. If that's what you are looking for, look no further! This is it. I am slightly disappointed I can't do multiple transfers, even by paying for a license. I want to transfer most of my Google fit data, except the steps, to Samsung Health, and then send just Samsung Health's step data to Google Fit to fully sync, and if that is ever an option I can implement, I will update my rating and comment to a solid 5 stars.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello, thanks for your nice review. I understand your wish, but what you want is very complex: activity data contains sometimes steps data, so separating steps and activity data will cause strange effects on the resulting data. So I'm afraid this won't be supported.

scraped_reviews.content: As someone who relies on multiple health tracking platforms, finding an app that seamlessly syncs data across Fitbit, Samsung, and Google Fit has been a game-changer. This app has filled a crucial gap in my health tracking routine, especially since my company health benefit tracker app doesn't sync with Samsung devices. With this app, I no longer have to spend time manually entering steps and sleep records. Its intuitive interface and reliable syncing make it a must-have.

It does exactly what it's intended to. The only thing I wish I didn't have to do is go into the app and hit refresh constantly. I use it to help track things on another fitness app that isn't android supported so it inputs the data I want but I just have to first go into the app and hit refresh for it to work in the other app. It's not a big deal, takes just a second, but would be nice if I didn't have to do that.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Ani, thanks for your review comment. To fix the automatic sync issue on your Samsung phone, please follow the directions on the website: https://healthsync.app/f-a-q/#samsungandroid12-13-14 If there is still a problem after you do this, please submit a problem report: open the Help Center menu, select the last option: Report another problem.

scraped_reviews.content: Wow, I wish I had known about this earlier. It truly solves a problem I've had for the past 2 years. My Galaxy watch takes blood pressure and heart rate, whereas i track my sleep with the Google nest hub. Through this app i can have everything in one place, very useful! Edit: Forgot to mention that an added value of this app is that there are third party apps (in my case cronometer) that will integrate with certain health data providers but not with others. this app fixes that too!

Perfect solution to multiple tracker sync. This app just got 5x better by letting you split what trackers go to what app instead of just to 1 other app. I have multiple fitness trackers, but not all will talk to each other, this fixes that issue and works very well. I have Samsung gear trackers that won't sync with Google fit and Withings devices that won't sync with Samsung. Now they can all sync together though this app. 5*'s.

Good app to communicate between apps. I use this app to have my Samsung Gear watch steps to be synced with Google Fit and Vitality Apps. For Samsung Health Users, You have to click 10 times on the version number (not the word 'version') that you see in the About page of Samsung Health. Then click on the Samsung Health version number. Click continuously until you see that *(Developer mode)* is added to that same line (left to the version number). Once that is done you can enable sync in app.

title: Yelp: Food, Delivery & Reviews
description: Yelp connects people with great local businesses! The one-stop travel, local, and food delivery app to discover nearby favorites. Whether you‚Äôre looking for restaurant reservations, to order food, a pet sitter, home services, auto repairs, local businesses, reviews, or something else - Yelp is here! Support local businesses with reviews, food delivery, home services, quotes & more. With over 200 million Yelp reviews worldwide, find local businesses for any need!
