summary: Free North America charts. Plan, log & share your boating trips with ease.

scraped_reviews.content: Finally a decent usable free app for boat navigation! There are so many others out there that claim to be free but their functionality is extremely limited or not even usable. Years ago I paid for one that that was supposed to be free for lifetime and it wasn't true. Now it costs over $100 a year. This one gives me very similar functionality with no cost and some enhancements that the other one did not even have. Plus their premium subscription is more than half of other competitors!

worse than useless. it gives you the impression that it might work, but doesn't. clicking on objects sometimes never responds, sometimes comes up a long time later. frequently completely locks up, needs to be restarted. i paid the upgrade, thinking the issue was the data needed to be preloaded, by downloading maps. (paid only) if anything, performance got worse. also got stuck where it wouldn't show the current route, but also wouldn't let me create new because i had a current route.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Sorry it was performing so erratically for you. Argo is a newer app and was designed for newer devices with at least 8GB of RAM. Our premium version does not have more data, just more features. https://argonav.io/premium/

scraped_reviews.content: Lifesaver! GPS function saved us! First time out on the boat, no cell service, no data, no roaming. I had read it won't work without data. Not all true. We were over 10 miles from where we launched, I made a wrong turn then lost! My only hope was this app! It showed our location as we navigated, I could see our destination on the map. Very happy boater! Thanks Argo!

This app could be fantastic but at least on Android I've had a very bad experience with it. Performance got really bad while on the water, and the point that shows my location and direction was almost never accurate, showing me crab walking as though the compass stopped working. Using the track feature at about 5 mph drew lines through islands that I was going around. After we got back to the dock, unloaded the boat and went back for the phone, the location was still catching up.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Sorry for your bad experience. We are working on this issue, although it does not seem to affect all users. It seems dependent on your device and internet connectivity. In cases of poor cell coverage we plan to take the internet connectivity out of the equation so that you have better performance on the water. Its a high priority for us.

scraped_reviews.content: Another nice looking nav app. However - did some basic routing and it had me going on the wrong side of a lighthouse and had me going through a breakwater. Think it has potential, but need a little polishing to fix these issues. Also, while trying to define my home port in my profile, although it let me find my marina easily, there didn't appear to be anywhere to save it without backing out and losing the info.

So far, not reliable. I have installed it twice on my android phone before I was able to get to the setup. I had problems from the start with it taking minutes to load. I then installed it on my android tablet and it sits there for longer on the blue Argo screen. I even purchased the premium subscription to see if it improved, but it didn't. When it did open on my phone, I was greeted with a spam friend request. After updating, it says update failed in top left corner. Not reliable navigation.

Argo was not "friendly" at first with regard to my Android device. The folks at Argo have worked tirelessly to fix my issues and, while it is still early, I believe they have. I have a Garmin Echomap and this app is incredibly easier to use than the Garmin. I cannot say enough about the support I have received from Jeff and the folks at Argo. Two words of advice: "Try it."

This app is terribly slow on wifi and basically useless with cell service. I have an android and used this on my sailboat. It is unable to refresh fast enough for depth changes and hazards. I gave it a few months to see if it would improve but it hasn't. The lag isn't just with updating location, all of the features have a lag of a minute or more. Like changing the map settings or setting locations. It is really frustrating. Would not recommend downloading, plenty of other free apps out there.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the feedback. Yes, we have also seen a lot of latency on Android devices. We are working on this and recently made some changes to improve that issue with our latest release 1.58.1 and will continue to investigate and improve.

scraped_reviews.content: Nothing like following their roots. It may say is the safest last shortest way there. Just to find out their maps are so far off and out of date that you're going to end up really screwed! Tried to tell me I was in 7 ft water just to find out I was in 8 inches or less of water. Definitely do not trust this app absolute trash! Well I'll tell you guys right now your maps are way off especially in the corpus Christi bay!!!!! I used my phone for the app with my GPS set to precise location.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: I'm sorry but I would need a better understanding as to how you were using the app. Our depth data is based on NOAA and Army Corp of Engineer surveys and although not perfect are generally quite accurate.

scraped_reviews.content: This app would be the perfect navigation app for casual boating if you could use it offline. If the maps could be preloaded or downloaded ahead of time I would pay for it. While most of my boating is within cell phone range, there are dead spots and losing signal at the wrong times makes the app's usability limited. PLEASE add offline maps. Even if it's just basic charts.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: The app does cache some of the local map, but I agree we need to download a larger area in case you lose cell coverage. We will work on that. Thanks for your feedback.

scraped_reviews.content: this is a great tool for when I'm at home or work and want to check out a body of water I plan on visiting. It doesn't have total coverage of lakes but gives you an idea of what to expect. I'm sure that with time it will keep improving
Works as expected. Enjoying the intuitive interface and easy to find features. Seems more features are being added and seeing updates pretty regularly.

I previously used Navionics for years but after Garmin purchased it the price skyrocketed. I have now been using Argo Navigation for about two months and I am extremely impressed. The Argo app is superior to Navionics in my opinion and the price is much more reasonable. A great little company that knows its business. Good riddance to Greedy Garmin!

this app has really improved in the last year. The developers are very responsive, and the support group responds quickly. in 2025, I have navigated both in the ICW and on the Atlantic, over 2,500 mi using Argo. I'm very pleased with it and would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a cell phone or tablet-based navigation application.

we just got our first sailboat and used this to get from Toronto to Burlington, it was great! We had some serious fog so we really relied on this for keeping distance from shore. It kept up with us perfectly, gave a heads up for any shallow areas and any potential obstructions, and was amazing! 10/10 recommend
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Glad you found the app helpful. We have made a lot of improvements this year.

scraped_reviews.content: good app accurate map has channels marked and a whole lot more
Love it. Best alternative to the new Navionics sadly own by Garmin.

Tried the FREE version of this app and I must say I was impressed. It did warn me that depths were not available which wasn't much of an issue where I was in northern Quebec. The navigation part REALLY helped us find our way back to home base! This is a newer app and they will keep adding more and more pertinent info when they get to it. Keep in mind there are A LOT of bodies of water across the US and Canada, that takes time to input. I'm using Argo on a Pixel 7 Pro without issues.
Download at home, set it all up was working good, got on the water and app just keeps shutting down. Takes a few minutes to open then immediately shuts down.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We unfortunately introduced a few unintended bugs with Version 2.9.0 as we were adding new features. Sorry about that. These were fixed in Version 2.9.1 which should perform much better.

scraped_reviews.content: tried to use the app several times, but it was way too glitchy. had a hard time loading and opened and closed the keyboard multiple times when trying to type. Couldn't send messages to support through the app because it was so bad. every time you'd get a few words typed in it would back out to the home screen then try to load again.

I downloaded app, subscribed to "premium" and it worked great inside my house (mobile data). Spent a whole afternoon planning a river voyage. Looked like the perfect solution. As soon as I hit the water, the app went offline, rendering it completely useless. There's supposedly some feature where maps can be downloaded offline, but app was completely unresponsive. THIS and EVERY other app like it make claims based on the "assumption" that connectivity is "never" a factor.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We have been working this offseason to make sure the app works when offline and recent feedback from our beta testers and users has been very positive. You might give it another try. But best to download chart areas and your saved route for where you plan to go before you get on the water.

scraped_reviews.content: Works fine while on shore and with Internet. Once go to the open water and no connection, no tide info, useless.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We are in the process of adding tide and current data for when you are off-line. Should have it soon.

scraped_reviews.content: Great App. Used it offline and worked perfect as long as GPS location is on.

I just found the BEST app called Argo Nav. It shows depth, the channels, and it lists my boat club on the map so I can just click to where I want to go and it gives me directions plus how many nautical miles and how long it takes! Plus it's FREE with no annoying ads in the way. Love it!!

Developers are responsive to requests. They are actively improving this app. Search by street address has been restored, thank you. Now to get the program to run on less powerful android machines, works great on my Samsung x 3 flip phone but totally hangs on my Samsung Active Tab 2 and that's the Tablet we use on our work boats as it works in a bright outside marine environment. Looking forward to a fix for that.

I love the app. I have app installed on my iPhone and it works great. I just bought a Lenovo tablet m10 with built-in GPS which is an Android. I downloaded the app without any issues. But when I try to open app my tablet it sends me to a bar stating I need to open up location and I have done. I would love to use the app on my tablet can you please help.

A TT guy that I know created this app & worked really hard on, so im going to do the best that I can. This app has the works for boaters; Captains Logs(!), friend messaging, maps, weather, tide, nav, AND A SOCIAL feed! App freezes in feedback page. The intro prompts that allow sliding a phone, when you swipe to next phone it needs to lock or line up - I got stuck between the images x3. For the record, this isn't pain and I don't own a boat. Awesome job!

The greatest boat app available. I am back on the water with a new bot after many years and with so many new establishments it has been great to visit places that my avid boater friends have not been. I tried the other 2 popular apps (they charge for them) and I had a very difficult time that I deleted them prior to finding Argo. This app hands down is the best!! Thank you

To slow. Takes forever to load up, it didn't record my trip at all, according to the app I was sitting in the parking lot for most of the day. The one thing that was useful was the depth, that seemed to work a majority of the time. Ended up deleting the app to search for another one.

scraped_reviews.userName: Chris Does What - DIY, Recipes, Reviews (Chris & Danielle)
scraped_reviews.content: We live on our boat as we navigate the East Coast. Getting around the ICW is really easy, one click and off we go. We use this app in combination with Waterway Guide so we don't mess any stunning destination. Once to a destination the we can log our trip in Argo's captains log, the share highlights of great spots directly on the app.

app is great, loading was a little slow, and i do enjoy using it, especially the premium features...however, im not renewing my annual subscription because the price doubled from $20 to $40. would be a 5 star review if you didnt raise the cost. jeff, you also sent me a email asking why i cancelled my subscription, stating 'please reply back as this is my personal email' and it got rejected because the email address i replied to was just another automatic spam email...kind of scammy, just saying.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Understand, that was our only price increase since adding the premium version almost 3 years ago. At the time it had 2 premium features, now 10. The price is still lower than other apps with the same features and we plan to keep it that way as we add more and more premium features. Not sure about the email issue. We will investigate.

scraped_reviews.content: Argo is the best boating navigation app I've used. It's easy to handle and is packed with information! Update: Customer service is top notch. Jeff genuinely cares about each user and he's putting his whole soul into the company. Seeing that I had an issue with my specific phone type, he took the time to update the app to fix the bugs. It works perfect now!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: It appears you are running app version 1.53.1 (May 2024). Argo is up to 1.62.4 and recent versions have fixed issues with Android devices. We have another BIG release coming this week. We did raise our prices but only to $39.99/yr, still below others that offer similar features. I know you were a fan. Hoping we can make it right for you again.

scraped_reviews.content: Great app, charts are great. They are continuing to update and add useful features. Receive emails all the time on helpful ways to use Argo Navigation. I've had no issues. Even ask questions and receive a reply each time. I would recommend Argo to anyone looking for a safe and useful way to navigate.

Does not operate as expected on Samsung Galaxy Flip 6; screen touches don't register, delayed response to touches, and lags badly. I think the app has potential, and I would pay for the premium version if it didn't have these issues on a Flip 6. I'm willing to run some tests for the dev team.

Email log in doesn't work, kicks you out after a few seconds. Downloaded latest update, same result. Must log in with Google and as soon as you do device (android) begins to get hot, sucking the battery. Charts are rudimentary and not available offline without subscription.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Appreciate the feedback. We will investigate. Charts are all based on NOAA and CHS ENC chart data and with premium you can customize the depth shading AND coming this week, contour lines too.

scraped_reviews.content: It works, but has serious performance problems on android ( pixel 8 pro) - also I'm not sure the map is fully up to date. It's good for a free app, but I didn't purchase it because of the performance issues, slow location timing, and out of date mapping. Fix these and you'd have a buy from me.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Performance is not an issue on all devices but we do not take that comment lightly and are making improvements to enhance overall performance. The charts have the very latest NOAA and CHS data. Not sure anything is out of date but if there is anything we'd be happy to fix.

scraped_reviews.content: Forces sign up. "Skip sign in" button does not work. I'm not interested in signing up for an unknown app that I may not like, so they can spam me with emails. Update after their response: Sadly, no. Still doesn't work. I tried downloading and reinstalling it today.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We've had some performance issues with Android devices but feel we have finally fixed them. Sorry you aren't willing to check it out. We feel we offer a great free app, and if you are worried about us sending you emails to help keep you informed about the app you can always unsubscribe.

scraped_reviews.content: Excellent App. If you have a boat, have friends, want to navigate safely, need to keep an eye on the weather. Share your fun with others. Message them and tell them your safe. Like to find your friends on the water, plan a safe route to your destination. This is a must have app. All at your finger tips. Amazing app.

I found this app is extremely dangerous! It takes you wherever it wants and doesn‚Äôt even know there are designated routes. Where I am, if you do not follow the routes, you will get bogged down in weeds or find yourself where you shouldn‚Äôt be. You MUST follow routes especially around islands. I tried this for the Trent Severn Waterway and it goes through dams, rapids and doesn‚Äôt know there are locks. Maybe it's ok for open lakes but inland bays full of weeds and rivers with locks, forget Argo!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We informed our users a few weeks ago we are in the process of integrating the official Canadian ENC chart data and during this time it is in beta and to please let us know of any issues. If you have specific examples that will help us to improve the chart data and routing which is based on this data that would be very helpful.

scraped_reviews.content: Easy for first time users. We used it to explore the greater Destin Florida area. Kept us out of trouble all day.

I downloaded this app for a pontoon boat rental at a local lake. It was super easy to get up and running with no issues. There's probably more features but it was good enough to make sure I was on track and able to get back to the marina. Definitely recommend to anyone new to these kinds of apps!

I love this app for it has given me the confidence to try new bodies of water. Great navigation, depth identities, and potentional restaurants. Our casual boating days have become so much more fun using this app. Thank you for the creativity and development, not to mention the free price tag.

I think this app deserves less than a 1 star.. Initially, as I read the posted 1 star reviews, I wasn't inclined to believe them, thinking they were the result of unupdated smartphones. However, unfortunately, now I joined their ranks, as I also experienced their frustrations. This app is simply not fully developed. Although it has promising features, but it's not ready yet. Perhaps someday... Good luck!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We added a new library to the app in mid November and that caused issues with Android devices, but it has been fixed.

scraped_reviews.content: Doesn't work for us as there are no real charts for Canada. There are "depth data" but these are not official (not for navigation). If/when actual charts are available in the future, I'll take another look. Developers ARE responsive.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: For Canada we added what depth data we could get from the Canadian government digitally but we are aware of deficiencies and are planning to make improvements before next boating season.

scraped_reviews.content: A truly great app and a great team behind it! They're always working hard to add more features and keep it up to date. As a casual boater it's a great way to help us get back home while we're out discovering new places! And they have a wonderful social media team and active presence! Very fun and engaging with their followers / users.

Just like everyone else seems to be saying, can't get it to open or do anything. Very frustrating after taking all the time to try. Maybe you should just scrap it and start from scratch or something? Seems like many people have this problem unless they are just talking it up like maybe one of your friends.?
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We have a new version coming in the next day or so which will have improved android performance.

scraped_reviews.content: This app is touch screen based and the latency is so huge that you don't know if your touch worked or not. Most don't work. Nice graphics but terrible usability. I'm on a fiber optic Wi-Fi connection so the issue is not the connection.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the feedback. We have also seen a lot of latency on the Pixel and other Android devices. We recently made some changes to improve that issue with our latest release 1.58.1 and will continue to investigate and improve.

scraped_reviews.content: Update: app freezes after entering GPS coordinates. Only way to get back is to close and restart. Great routing app. Not super accurate with depths, but has the basics down pat. I love love love all the communication from the developers!! Keep it coming!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: If it is freezing up it is likely due to poor connectivity. We just released a new feature that will alert you when this is occurring and giving you an option to go to offline mode. Depths at your location are based on NOAA and CHS which are at MLLW (mean low level water). It may be possible the actual water levels are higher and not at MLLW.

scraped_reviews.content: I love this awesome app. I use it up and down the south Florida icw. More than a year of use and still the best app out there! I share it with others and constantly get thanked for recommending it... Always improving and just keeps getting better, excellent and I highly recommend for on the water use plotting trips estimate on travel time fuel usage and so much more.

So, this app is like no other in that you can route with a couple clicks. It's "google maps" for the water. I also reached our to the app developer and received professional help. A must have app if you own a boat!!! Thanks.

title: Weather
description:
Get the latest forecast with Pixel‚Äôs exclusive weather app. You can also:
  ‚Ä¢ See AI-generated overviews of the weather with helpful tips
  ‚Ä¢ Easily track weather in multiple locations
  ‚Ä¢ Get up-to-the-minute precipitation forecasts
  ‚Ä¢ See a precipitation map
  ‚Ä¢ Receive severe weather warnings
  ‚Ä¢ Enjoy AI generated weather backgrounds
  ‚Ä¢ Customize your experience
  ‚Ä¢ Set alarms to wake up to a weather forecast
  ‚Ä¢ See personal weather insights for plans affected by the weather within the next 10 days

  Feature availability may vary depending on your region, language, and device.
descriptionHTML:
Get the latest forecast with Pixel‚Äôs exclusive weather app. You can also:
‚Ä¢ See AI-generated overviews of the weather with helpful tips
‚Ä¢ Easily track weather in multiple locations
‚Ä¢ Get up-to-the-minute precipitation forecasts
‚Ä¢ See a precipitation map
‚Ä¢ Receive severe weather warnings
‚Ä¢ Enjoy AI generated weather backgrounds
‚Ä¢ Customize your experience
‚Ä¢ Set alarms to wake up to a weather forecast
‚Ä¢ See personal weather insights for plans affected by the weather within the next 10 days

Feature availability may vary depending on your region, language, and device.
summary: Your integrated and personalized weather app for Pixel

scraped_reviews.content: This seems to be becoming more and more unreliable. Consistently, the app is saying we are in the middle of a strong thunderstorm (for hours at a time) while there's not a cloud in the sky. There's also not even a rain shower showing up on the weather map for hundreds of miles. Also, the app loves to display a feels like temp of 76¬∞ almost all the time. This app also desperately needs radar. The weather map will show no rain to be seen, yet it's currently pouring.

One star for not being easily able to switch up the units of the various weather data. You can go into System->Languages->Regional Preferences and change "Temperature" to "Celsius", of course, but that only changes the temp units in the Weather app, which is somehow dumber than not changing it at all. Embarrassing. Disabling the app brings back all the old stuff, though, so at least there's that.

It's mostly fine, but this thing where it keeps asking me to update my permissions to give it a more precise location has to go away. It's weather. You don't need to know where I am within 10 feet or 100 feet or 1000 feet of my real location, and it is exceedingly invasive to keep pushing this obviously unnecessary level of location tracking. One of many increasingly invasive features that make me want to leave Android altogether.

It's pretty consistently wrong. Right now the current conditions in the app say "light rain starting in about an hour" but outside it is literally a torrential downpour and has been for a couple hours. I have yet to see the forecast or current conditions be correct. I've done all the location troubleshooting, I just don't think the internal algorithm knows how to interpret the weather. The Weather Channel website and app are generally correct or much closer to actual conditions.

Atrocious inaccurate App. It will no longer show my location correctly. (the old version used too). Now, the small map just below the incorrect location is correct!!. The correct location is one of my 'saved' locations, but there is no way to change the saved location to your actual location. It's not rocket science, but it cannot do it. It has the correct County I live in....but it's a big County!!!.

The app provides useful information and seems to be accurate enough. The main issue is that every single day the app takes 5-10 minutes to find my location, and it kills the watch battery. I'm not sure why this is, but it is extremely annoying. I turn on Wi-Fi, BT, & location on both watch and phone and get error message after error message. Someone suggested going outside to update it. Really? I need to go outside to use this app? Crazy. App would be an easy 5 stars if this wasn't an issue.

All good but make 10-day forecast vertical again!! It's honestly so much less user friendly when I can't look at all 10 days at the same time. It's one thing for it to be that way in the general overview (though it still sucks), but quite another to tap on it and still have to scroll to the side to see more than a week out. It's not aesthetic, it's not practical, it's not user friendly to have to swipe that way that far up on the screen, AND I can't take a screenshot to show family the weather.

Widgets are very limited. Having more than two options would be great. Along with choosing which shapes to match your Material You theme, or an option for transparent backgrounds. Options to choose what is shown on the widget, such as AQI, would also be more useful. Otherwise, we are just limited to two simple and non-customizable widgets that the majority of users don't really like.

at a glance never works with weather ever since i upgraded my phone. my pixel 6a shows the weather all the time. since upgrading, weather only shows via AAG when my location is on & always disappears minutes after turning off location. i like to preserve my battery as much as possible, never kept location on with any of my previous phones. if google keeps it as a requirement, this is my last android. chose to force quit pixel weather and switched to a weather channel widget. AAG sucks, thx TWC!

Icons for Pixel Weather on the lock and home screens come and go... still, months and months after being first reported. The underlying data is available as demonstrated by going to the Play store and opening the Pixel Weather app. Why fixing this unmissably visible bug, still present on the latest version of Android (16), is beyond Google's capabilities to fix is incomprehensible.

Inaccurate and inconsistent reporting. I'm writing this review while absolutely getting rocked by a thunderstorm and the app says "Rain starting around 11PM". It's currently 9:15 and has been raining for an hour. üòÖ The radar also indicates that the rain started an hour ago, so it's strange how different all aspects of the app are from one another. This is not a new occurrence, either. I just checked two other weather websites and Google's radar isn't even close to accurate, either. üòí

I've only had this weather app for about a month. Tried several other weather apps and none were accurate like this one. I'm very pleased with it!! I haven't seen any ads whatsoever! Very basic too. Not like some, that will predict snowfall in Alaska. Why do I want to know that?? I live in Florida, for Pete's sake!! Lol! Anyways, it's very deserving of a 5 star review!! üòé

The weather is usually accurate enough but at least that still works... My app settings menu has been straight up blank for months (at least since February 2025) so I can't change temperature units, toggle the AI summaries, or whatever else is in there. The units thing irks me b/c that's an extremely basic feature to be missing üôÑ. Also the same update that broke the settings broke the weather widget so I have to use another app for that... Why'd y'all do this, Google???

I think two stars is being very generous, and they're mostly for the overall look and style (though more options for this would be great). The widget isn't resizeable in a useful way, like 5x1 - it automatically switches to the smaller widget. My widget is losing the location name once it refreshes. It takes giving up location all the time in order to work correctly. And it seems to switch from a few-days-long outlook forecast to an hourly one whenever it feels like it. A whole lot of meh.

Where's froggy?? üê∏ That was a fun way to start the day, seeing what my buddy was up to! The cute variations made it fun. Now it's all streamlined and boring. It definitely doesn't have the same ease of use....you have to click on each header to get more detailed information, instead of having it all in one screen. But, overall, I want froggy back!! üòÑ

The previous vertical layout of 10 day weather was much better. Could get an instant view and take a screenshot without having to scroll right. Same goes for hourly weather. Vertical is better. That's how all calendars, including Google calendar is layed out. Would be good to see the weather in the calendar as well, since weather has to always be considered when planning events.

This new version of the Google weather app is awful. No more quick searches of different locations, which makes it hard to plan out motorcycle or bicycle rides that go through different places at different elevations and experience different weather patterns. You can only save new locations. Save. That's it. You can't delete them as far as I can tell. I go through a lot of places once or twice and then never again, I don't need to keep seeing weather for those places after my trip. Trash app.

The new version is terrible. It's difficult to change units and the new horizontal 10-day forecast was a bad decision. The vertical one was much more user friendly. Please give us an option to change back to the previous UI. In the meantime, I am using a different weather app now... Edit: I just saw from another review, you can get the old interface back by disabling the new app (Pixel Weather).

Conceptually nice. Clean and simple with ability to customize the stuff you want to see first at the top instead of a clog of metrics you might not care about for a quick glance. Unfortunately, until the widgets work with a saved location instead of requiring GPS always on, can't consider it a serious option. I would also prefer the radar map be able to start an hour or two before current time so you can see patterns as they move through rather than just from the present forward.

Overall, I'm really enjoying the new weather app. The addition of weather maps is huge. My one problem, please, PLEASE bring back the search bar. When I search for a location, I usually do not want to add it to my "Saved Locations" list, I just want to check the weather, you know, IN THE WEATHER APP. It is unbelievably clunky to tie "add location" in with search. Let me search for any location, then decide myself if I want to save it or not. As it is, I have to go in and delete after...

The biggest complaint I have, is that the widget, weather app, and at a glance don't sync up. They all show a different temperature. Usually it's close, but it's just a simple thing that ruins it for me. And the widget won't update to current locations at random times. Not my favorite weather app anymore. and after using it for awhile, it's not that accurate. The actual weather and the weather it reports is not the same.

I don't know why this was changed. The previous UI was much easier to read and had a better flow to it. Now if I click on the weather it has a pop up every time asking to turn on notifications which I do not want EVER. There's no option to tell it that. Then I have to put in a location or save one for it to even do anything. I don't like using my current location all the time and don't like being asked to do so constantly. The other UI was less intrusive. Stop changing things that already work!!

This is like looking at the weather through a keyhole. Oversized icons limit the amount of data available at a glance. Ten-day forecast icon is now truncated; tapping it opens yet another truncated view. Data units are either all Imperial or a mix-mash of Imperial/metric. Must add a location to the list just to check it once. European locations lack air quality and weather map icons although available on the website. Worst of all, Google killed the frog. No more frog, no more Google Weather.

Last night's AI forecast stated, "Expect a chilly day with warm temperatures..." Seriously? It was 18F today. I'm giving two stars for the wealth of weather data but can I trust the accuracy? Don't think so. I miss the weather frog. I'm looking for another app. Also, barometric pressure as a standalone reading is mostly not useful. It should indicate if it's rising or falling.

App is great, but Google constantly wants to track my location. This has huge impact on my phone battery life. hope they find some solution that don't need such intensive location tracking, I am at the same place everyday, same office, same apartment, same gym, how hard is it to share weather updates of same location without tracking me all the time.

It has always had a tendency to get stuck in a past location. In older versions I could fix it by selecting "use precise location", but with the most recent update it's hard to find that screen and selecting "use precise location" doesn't do anything. So I have been getting weather for Stow for the past 8 hours when I've been in Akron for the past 7.

I want to love this but it is failing at its most fundamental use case. Temperature accuracy is consistently inaccurate where the lows are almost always incorrectly stated. Sometimes the low temp will be outside of the app's temperature range for the day. Other times it will not report low enough temperatures. Again, fundamental issues for a weather app. If you can't trust the temperature it's providing, then it's not useful.

I only want severe weather alerts on the places I select. That's not a listed option. But I can set it to tell me it's raining. Telling just stupid, I can see it when I look out the window. Also, I don't want the app tracking my location. I don't travel that much and I don't want the battery drain. So constantly telling me to update my location settings when I HAVE DONE SO, is annoying. And yes these are major annoyances to me.

Only works when it wants to. One minute it's giving me notifications on real time weather, then I can't find it anywhere. As a matter of fact, I'm not getting any of my notifications. Great phone Goggle. But, when I go on the app, it's not a bad interface. I don't like the way the radar works, but the AI weather reporting is pretty kewl.

The problem with this app is you can't set your home location which is a problem. I'm not leaving my location turned on my phone 24/7 just so it knows where I'm at all times. I just need to set my home location for weather and I can look up weather manually if I travel. My weather app tells me the weather for the wrong location because I assume it uses the WiFi's ping location. This app needs fixed.

Why did they get rid of FROGGY? :'( I am so upset that I installed the latest Android update and the weather app was also updated to the newest version. There's way too much information and the interface is NOT user friendly. And I miss froggy! Sometimes I would check the weather just to see what he was doing. BRING BACK THE OLD APP WITH FROGGY!

While I had high hopes for this when it debuted last year with the Pixel 9, all other reviewers are right, this weather app is horribly inaccurate. I've reverted to the old "frog" weather app by disabling this app entirely which is oddly more accurate which I can only think is related to AI having some influence and the lack of ensuring the forecast is accurate. just hope they don't turn off frog weather, otherwise I'll just use Weather Underground through Firefox (hyper-local forecasts).

Very disappointed. I've come back to Android from iPhone for the latest Pixel and this weather app is just not up to snuff. The most frustrating thing is that it never maintains my current location. After a while it changes to a nearby location and I'm unable to get back correct unless I completely clear all data and cache. I have to do this regularly or it shows an incorrect location.

Downgrade from the prior version. I liked the prior version better. And on the automatic update, it lost all of my favorite location settings. The GPS auto location is now always showing my county weather instead of my preferred town weather. There doesn't seem to be a way to set my default. It just does what it wants to do.

New update does not have weather available for a default location unless you share precise location on your phone and I do not do that. If I want weather for my home area, I have to save it as one of my favorites and choose it from the list each time I get into the app. It needs the ability to choose a default location from the favorites list if they are no longer allowing it to default to estimated location.

So much worse than the old experience!!! When I unfold my phone HALF OF THE SCREEN is now dedicated to just the temperature, which is a terrible use of space. In the old app this gave me a scrollable element for the entire week When I tap the icon on the home screen, instead of going right to details, it makes me pick my location from a list. I do not want to keep my GPS on 24/7 when I'm in the same city 95% of the time! Adding the radar gets this 2 stars instead of 1.

Today they killed the weather frog. It isn't like we didn't see it coming but it is still a sad day. The frog has been my weather buddy for a while and I shall miss him. As for the app, other than it has lost its pep, the rest looks okay and I like the ability to move individual items around. I was a lot less happy that it lost my saved places.... Almost as if the app installed before was completely replaced by a new app that has no connection to the previous app.

It's an okay app. I like some of the new features like the weather map and being able to click on different parts to get more information. Although I'm still going to use the old google weather (with the little frog). You can still get in by searching weather in the google app then clicking the 3 dots and click add to home screen. I find this version a little harder to read at a glance.

I like the layout and information on the apps main screen however the radar is slow, choppy and subpar compared to other weather apps. Also, I don't mind some advertising since it is free however I believe they are a little excessive on this app and I don't like how they design them to make it harder to close. Just give me a short ad once in a while with an "x" in the top right corner after a short time.

Can't search a location without having it saved and no easy way (or any way) to delete saved locations? Individual widgets for precipitation, visibility, etc too big and not visually appealing. 10 day forecast to scrunched. The horizontal scrolling for it is terrible. No dates for the 10 days. I wish ai would stop being pushed. I don't need an ai summary of the weather. Worst of all no froggy! Overall it's just quite ugly and a downgrade from the previous version.

Pixel 8 Pro here. Too much AI. Not enough radar. My lock screen said it was supposed to be a high of 80 the other day and scared me, because it was in the 50s and rainy. But most of all, where did my haptic feedback raindrops go? I've toggled them on and off multiple times and force quit, cleared the cache, etc. Yet another example of Google struggling to make their apps compatible with their phones.

Widget requires location services to function.....This is the first weather app I have used that forces you to share your location in order to see the forecast. It doesn't even show the last location that you had location on at - it shows nothing. Please just let us pick a spot to see the weather of. A lot of folks don't like keeping location services on 24/7.

Touting clock app integration as a benefit because you can get a weather report with an alarm is a joke. It may be useful for a morning wakeup alarm but there is no reliable independent access to the weather app. There are many great weather apps to choose from with great widgets but my preference is for simplicity. All I want is a simple 1-line status of current conditions on the main screen that I can tap for a detailed report. The Google weather page is great ... if you can get to it üòû

It's ok, but where did the frog go? And why do I now have to select a location every time I open the app? No ability to casually browse the weather in other locations, I have to add them as a saved location first? Also wasn't there supposed to be a pollen index widget? That was the only change I was looking forward to but I'm not seeing it on my Pixel Fold 1. Thankfully I'm not seeing the shoehorned in AI either. The weather map appears to do...nothing? Seems a bit botched and clunky.

App is junk now since you disconnected from The Weather Channel. Rainfall is showing up with precip chances of only 5 to 10% making most days seem rainy when they're not. Today the app told me there would be 2.97cm of rain, rain is usually measured in mm (or ins) - going into the hourly detail shows about 14mm. The numbers NEVER match up! The app is also constantly reminding me to share location all the time. There's no need to know my location all the time and it drains battery.

One problem, stop asking me to update my location permissions. If I want a location, I'll add it. You don't need more of my data. Outside of this issue, Google made a great weather app. It's simple, accurate, easy to use. Please, for the love of God, don't change it (except for the constant location permissions request). Get rid of that, and it'll be a 5-star app.

I like how the app looks and how the data is presented in the tiles. But the inconsistency in what you are allowed to see makes it hard to actually use. Sometimes you get radar, usually you don't. Even when you do, the radar is terrible. I'm not sure why tiles only appear when Google decides I want to see them.

Visually the app is nice. The radar usually doesn't match the radar of any other apps or what's happening outside, not sure where Google is pulling its information from. The app can say it's partly cloudy when it's been raining heavily for an hour regardless of how many times you refresh the app. Sometimes the "rearrangeable modules" don't always stay in the position you place them in and revert to default.

After update, need location on permanently to show current weather on home screen ( pixel 7 ) . Without location on home screen shows weather temp in Chicago ( I'm in so cal ) Annoying but still better than other weather apps . Location on burns up battery too fast. So now , no , at a glance on my home screen weather.üò≠ ALSO.....No way to erase saved locations . If you accidentally enter a wrong location in " saved locations" your stuck with it .

Latest update is horrible. I used to be able to switch between Fahrenheit and Celsius with three clicks, now I have to go deep into my settings. Can no longer check the weather for another city without adding that city to my saved locations. Neither of these changes make for a better experience, but thanks for the useless AI features.

title: Audible: Audio Entertainment
description:
Escape into stories you love with Audible. Discover a world of audiobooks, exclusive podcasts, and Audible Originals‚Äîwhere powerful storytelling meets immersive sound. Download audiobooks & podcasts to listen offline, so you are never without a great story. 

Discover thousands of titles across every genre: mystery, self-development, romance, sci-fi, fantasy, and more. Personalize your experience with features like adjustable narration speed, sleep timer, and bookmarks & notes. Everything you like & more: with the world's largest audiobook library, you're sure to find the perfect title ‚Äì bestsellers, exclusive Originals, and podcasts.

Stream your favorite audiobook or podcast series narrated by a star-studded voice cast. Keep one podcast or audiobook every month as a Premium Plus member or purchase your favorite titles with cash. Stream books you‚Äôve been meaning to read for years and browse through thousands of original podcasts.

Start building better habits with Audible today: listen to meditation books or inspiring health & wellness podcasts. Transform your day and trade endless scrolling for endless listening. Chores can be fun with Audible.

Listen before you watch‚Äîdive into the audiobooks of your favorite books before they hit the screen. Transport yourself to tomorrow with Audible: download an audiobook to enjoy on your next flight or listen to podcasts on the road with Car Mode.
Listen while commuting, cooking, working out, or winding down. Use Car Mode on epic journeys, listen on your Wear OS, or connect with any Bluetooth or Alexa-enabled device for hands-free playback.

AUDIBLE FEATURES

THE PLUS CATALOG: LISTEN TO ORIGINALS
Podcasts, audiobooks, and Originals. Listen to thousands of titles, including exclusive series.
‚Ä¢ Download audio content in the Plus Catalog anytime you want, no credits necessary
‚Ä¢ Extensive audio library ‚Äì listen to your favorite audiobook & podcast titles
‚Ä¢ Originals & bestsellers ‚Äì purchase and listen to trending favorites

NOVELS, PODCASTS, & AUDIOBOOKS: ANYTIME, ANYWHERE
Dig into thrilling listens, popular audiobooks or eye-opening podcasts:
‚Ä¢ Offline listening ‚Äì Download your favorite titles and enjoy them wherever you are, without Wi-Fi
‚Ä¢ Audiobooks or podcast series ‚Äì Listen on the road with Car Mode
‚Ä¢ Read a book on your Kindle or switch to listen on your phone, tablet or Wear OS
‚Ä¢ Listen to health & wellness content to help you build better habits

AUDIO ENTERTAINMENT: IGNITE YOUR IMAGINATION
Take your library with you ‚Äî your stories go where you go. Audiobooks travel light.
‚Ä¢ Stream your reading list while tackling chores
‚Ä¢ Create personalized playlists with podcasts and audiobooks
‚Ä¢ Customize narration speed ‚Äî up to 3.5x
‚Ä¢ Leave reviews & help others discover their next favorite story

AUDIBLE MEMBERSHIP
New to Audible? Try membership free for 30 days. Amazon Prime members get 2 free credits with their first Audible trial that can be used on any 2 titles from our premium selection. Try cash purchases for titles you love and benefit from discounted prices as an Audible member.

AUDIBLE PREMIUM PLUS
With Premium Plus, you can access the Plus Catalog and much more:
‚Ä¢ Plus Catalog ‚Äì thousands of titles, podcasts, and Originals
‚Ä¢ Get 1 monthly credit to choose any title you want
‚Ä¢ Listen to an extended selection of bestsellers, Originals and new releases
‚Ä¢ A permanent library! Titles purchased with credits are yours to keep, even if you cancel

KIDS PROFILES
Create a Kids Profile for your child and share family-friendly listens from our extensive catalog of children‚Äôs audiobooks, podcasts and Originals, right from the app.

Purchase titles directly or acquire individual credits through the app and expand your audio library anytime with Audible.

-

The most compelling stories and podcasts, told by inspiring voices. Listen to storytelling that speaks to you, anytime, anywhere. Fall in love with books all over again with Audible, an Amazon company.

scraped_reviews.content: I used to love this app, but lately, it's been driving me crazy. Regardless of the settings, it starts on its own, both in the car and when I'm using earbuds. I've tried turning off the auto start setting, but it does no good. It frequently stops when I'm listening with my earbuds while walking, and this week, it has decided to restart my book from the beginning when I get in the car - 3 times! Then it takes about 30 minutes of advancing the book 30 seconds at a time to get back to where I off.

I've been using Audible for yrs. Until recently, I've had only a couple of hiccups which I would consider a normal. Lately, my books always stopped working at the end. I would have to delete the app & redownload. After 3 books, I contacted audible. The person helping me reloaded those books, which I'd already finished, & asked me to check them. As the issue happened while listening to 10-22 hr long books, I thought that seemed impractical. She refused to do a deeper dive. My issue persists.

super frustrating app. We use it all the time, because there's no other choice, but I absolutely hate it. Recommendations are abysmal, typically they are for books already in my library, or for trash you could not pay me to listen to. But this is all a matter of taste, of course, and really the least of the problems. More fundamentally, the app constantly malfunctions. it's anyone's guess whether a title will play or not on a given day. Search lists reorder themselves mid-browse. etc. etc.

Terrible app. The only reason to use the service is the Monopoly Amazon has on the market. I don't think I have gotten more than a week and a half without the app deleting everything that's been downloaded. New problem has started recently, app keeps "starting you where you left off on another device" which sounds great if it meant that you start at the most recent place you stopped listening. what audible is doing is moving me back to where I was at 8am, making it impossible to advance.

Books not downloading, have been fighting for a good 30 min to an hour to get anything to download. App has devolved into utter rubbish, but hey it has AI now, that's what we all really want right? The problems with the app are persistent and dont seem to be a priority to fix. It still randomly closes while listening as well. Takes forever to load if not connected to internet and books will randomly forget they are downloaded, forcing a long fight to redownload. Use at own risk!

The App functions these days, not well, but it's like it has multiple versions all fighting internally to be the version. so I never know what I'm going to get. Some days all my bookmarks disappear sometimes they reappear. Sometimes I can view the most recent bookmark first, sometimes I can't. Sometimes the "end of chapter" timer displays one way and sometimes the other. Often I have to reboot my whole phone to get the app to function. Sometimes my books freeze. Ugh.

I love that i can "read" books while I work. craft. cook and a myriad of other things. its a decent app, I wish the previews actually previewed a bit of the actual book rather than opening credits that you can't skip past. Some authors voices can be annoying, so I hate to spend the money if I won't like it. One recent book kept repeating lines. not sure if it was the book or the app. More credits would be nice for the monthly cost. especially loyal listeners

Too much advertising! Open the app and it bombards you with sales and begs for subscriptions. After you make a purchase and try to go view your library you're bombarded with more sales of your wishlist in your library. It is CONSTANT and aggravating and needs to stop. Let me view my own audiobooks that I have already paid for without being blasted with more ads. For God's sake, let me access my stuff. Stop trying to sell to me at every possible turn. Enough is enough. Good grief.

Not much good to listen to anymore. Every couple of weeks, starting last month, they remove just a little bit more of the good books to listen to. When I started this membership, I understood the 1 credit and some free books to read. I found a pretty good amount of free(with the $12.99 mo. membership) books to read. Now that supply has DRASTICALLY been reduced and most audiobooks available are virtual voice or bad narration. What's the point of having a membership when you have to pay more?

When one of my favorite authors dropped a new title, I came back to Audible after 6 months using another app. Imagine my disappointment when the app crashes anytime another app sends a notification. Maps and Messenger sometimes crash it, but the camera "click" when taking pictures is pretty much guaranteed. For someone making package deliveries all day, this is unacceptable.

I'm having the same issue many others have mentioned - no matter what my settings are, when my phone connects to Bluetooth in my car, Audible automatically starts up. Not only that - it starts playing a book I've already marked finished and archived. It's EXTREMELY aggravating not only that the issue exists in the first place (there's no way there's no fix for this, Amazon!), but also people have been complaining about this issue for literally YEARS and nothing has been done.

App keeps getting worse and worse! There are now ads at the end of every book! You pay for the service, and you buy the books, and there are still advertisements. You can queue a title to play next or use collections to play books in order but both are glitchy. They also removed the option to bookmark your library to that from your home screen. I never shop in the app, so waiting for the store to load is a waste of time. I've had a subscription since 2006, and EVERY update makes the app worse!

First, I absolutely adore the vast selection of books to choose from, and have had MANY suggestions they've given me that were "included in your membership" that have grown to be favorites. Second, the app is buggy as hell with the tech help not very helpful. I've had the same issues through 4 different phones. The app will randomly crash and I have to close it down and restart it to get it playing again. Tech assumes it's just one book and doesn't listen when I say it's ANY book.

The app should be an audiobook player, but is seems to exist primarily to try to get you to buy more audiobooks. The app loads into a "Home" screen in name only: it's actually a storefront with suggestions for what to buy/use credits on. Every book ends with a preview for a suggested listen, completing ruining the sense of finality you get at the end of the book you listened to.

Not enough books to choose from, and shorter books are the same cost as longer books. If the book is eight hours or less, it shouldn't be a full credit. Or maybe you should have a plan for manga listening so you can listen to three volumes for one credit--I'd pay for an add-on so I could use my credits for normal books or manga if you did this!--but right now, it's far from satisfactory. Also, why are most of the "free" narrators rubbish? Quality control would be lovely.

I like audible. The issue is the app for me it malfunctions when I wanted to work the most. Play back button works when it wants to and then when you download it doesn't necessarily save it to your phone so if you don't have internet access you don't get access to the book. I don't know if it's just a me problem or other people have the same issue.

Price is pretty steep for only 1 book credit per month and the moderate functionality of the app. Combine that with controlling how long you need to listen to something before you can leave a review on it and the lack of consistency of available titles from a series and there's not much left for positive feedback. Doesn't take hours of listening to determine that a certain narrator is doing a poor job and want to inform other listeners before they waste their 1 credit/money on a title.

My main issue with this app is how incredibly difficult it is to refine my search within the audible plus catalog. Which is frustrating considering I'm paying. I've gone back and forth with memberships for years. I own MANY books. I never get recommendations in the plus catalog based on my library and it's always the same free books. Since discovering I can get MANY books for free via my local library's apps. I've been even more less inclined to pay for audible.

Clips and bookmarks is one of the most important features for the user to retain information after listening to a book. But it's one of the most ignored features as well. You can't read your notes beyond the first few words. Earlier you could tap to expand and be able to read your fell note for each of the bookmarks. Also, that screen doesn't retain your position in the list after you go out of that screen. Once you go back to the bookmarks page you have to scroll all the way again. Terrible!

Good selection, good play settings/features like changing the speed of the book, and it's great that if you hate a book, you can return it and get your credit back. BUT it only let you sort your library by the author's FIRST name instead of the author's LAST name?! I tried to get tech support help for the issue, but apparently this ridiculousness is by design. PLEASE fix this so you can search by the author's last name. Most libraries and many bibliophiles use this method.

I like the audio books, they're obviously great. The app on the other hand is anything but great. It seems like they rearrange where things are on an almost monthly basis. It's insanely annoying having to waste 10 minutes just trying to find my wishlist because it's now on a sub tab under Library rather than on the tab with the store (you know, where you buy the books that you wish listed).

So many choices! I love the diverse and endless selection of stories, podcasts, and more. I can search for new reads by genre, author, narrator, and more. Great sales all the time, the 2 for 1 sales allows me to get best-selling books at 1/2 price. The 4.99 sales are my favorite, which allows me to explore new reads and authors at a ridiculously low price. I use Augible every day, during my drive to and from work,and while doing mindless tasks at home...just put in your earbuds, and you're set.

for the most part, it's great! recently started pausing on it's own and/or stopping completely and shutting down. my phone tells me to put it in deep sleep mode due to recurring crashes. sometimes won't connect to my Bluetooth device even though my other stuff will. after i close the app and restart it, it will play most of the time. please fix the bugs!!

Sure I enjoy listening to audiobooks. I would enjoy them much more if the app I'm using to access those audiobooks, audiobooks that I spend a not insignificant amount of $, didn't crash every 5 -10 minutes some days. Driving in traffic (crash), working at my desk (crash), listening before bedtime (crash) etc. I've even considered buying some gray-market software to copy my Audible purchases to a different format to avoid the issue. Short version, Audibles' audio player blows goats.

Deceptive cancelation process. I tried to cancel my subscription over a month ago. I hit "cancel" twice, both times the app put other offers in my face to try to get me to keep the service. I didn't know that you have to hit "cancel" THREE times before they'll actually cancel your subscription. Well, congratulations, you conned an extra month out of me and ensured I'll never pay for your services again.

Bring back the 10 minute sleep timer. I'm gonna be that guy - I've used the 10 minute interval for like 5 years now and they just dropped it out of the blue. Yes, you can add it as a custom timer, but doing so takes 3 clicks every single time. If you're going to remove a feature, at least give us the option to manually add our own (that we don't have reset every single time with 3 clicks).

I had a subscription for a little over a year, loved it at first. end of summer had had money problems and couldn't pay for it. so it got canceled ( my fault completely) but what upset me was the credits I paid with my subscription being taken away. I had 5 and cant believe you take them away from people when it was already paid for. I was about to restart my subscription now that im in a better place but wont be cause of that. not worth it.

generally good, but the book playback controls no longer stays at the bottom of the screen. Any time I pause, do something else, and later go back into the app(even if it's still open) the bottom playback bar disappears so I have to make several clicks to hit play and continue listening. It used to not be this way, please fix it!

Wish the 5 minute audio previews were something other than the forward, proluge, or introduction. Instead, a 5 minute segment from the first chapter would be a better preview option. Perhaps allowing a selection option for the customers to choose a sample from anywhere in the book for the 5 minute duration would be beneficial. This may help the customers to make better decision on purchases.

the app cost about 15 a month (but for some reason I was always charged twice ) and you get 1 credit a month which is enough to get 1 book. but when you cancel your membership you lose your unused credits. and the books really aren't worth $15. spend your credits or they will take them save your money I suggest trying smart audible or there are alot free one that won't cost

I've been using this app for years! and now the damn thing keeps crashing, freezing, randomly closing. it's pissing me off and frustrating. I have deleted the app and re-installed. I have made sure the phone(galaxy s25 ultra) and app are up to date. no other apps are running. between this and the news that they are paying authors pennies per book. maybe I need to find somewhere else to spend $75/month

Mostly great. *Recently, I'm experiencing a bug that constantly repeats a warning that the title I'm listening to will soon no longer be free with my membership. The popup reappears literally every time it is cleared. Long story made short, it makes listening to this title nearly impossible.* Aside from that (and Amazon's business practices) this app works well. I enjoy having access to titles free with my membership, and easy purchases of books with either credits or money.

I have always loved this app and have subscribed whenever I can afford it. unfortunately almost all of the book included now through subscription are all read by virtual voice, they can be hard to understand and mispronounce things constantly. There is also "poorer" titles available, as in, not as good. somethibg has changed this past year and its not good.... thinking I might have to go elsewhere....

All they seem focused on is looks while making things more difficult to do. For example I use bookmarks as I listen to make sure I can go back to a point where I was paying attention. This works well for me, but I end up with 50-100+ bookmarks by the time I finish a book and I have to manually select each one. Their recent UI change makes it so I see fewer bookmarks at a time. there is no way to clear bookmarks. Then each bookmark comes with a "clip" which I wish I could disable.

I have had several problems w app. Books not the same on two devices. App has also stopped working and I had to reload. This is not easy when I am in an area without internet and not something I want to have to do, particularly, while I am in the middle of gardening, chopping wood or a walk. This has started happening in last few months. prior to that 5 stars.

For me the app has gotten better. The only request I have is that when a series has been completed that some indication is made in the app. Having to open each series to see what's left is annoying. I really like how when a new book is released it shows on the home screen under the author. I'm with someone else post where it automatically starts no matter how you change the settings. One day mom was in the car. Can we say not good. Was a steamy scene and not prepared..LOL!

Once again, I have to recommend people to not download the app. If you already have it download, do not update to the latest version. It is buggy as can be and is constantly crashing. It is to the point I can't even listen to 5 min of an audiobook without the app crashing and restarting over a dozen times. If you skip forward or rewind, it will crash. I really hope they release a fix soon. It is to the point that the app is about unusable now.

I've been using the Audible app since it was first launched. Although some features have been added that I like (control of playback speed, sleep timer, etc), the app has become less stable over time. It seems to have conflicts with notifications and some programs that I can't control (Tmobile junk). Then the app just stops and I have to reboot the phone. Not at all convenient when driving or during a workout! The library search function has never been very good.

Apparently purchasing the credit to buy a book each month isn't enough to be considered as purchasing the book. Every time I need some time between books and cancel for a while, Audible takes the last book I used a credit to get and tells me I have to pay for it because it isn't "included in my plan." It better not be included in my plan since I straight up paid for it, but that doesn't help the fact that I have had to repurchase books after spending $14.99 on it already. Multiple times too!

Audiobook collection is solid. I was surprised they had bools from one of my favorite authors, who is Scottish and whose books are difficult to find in the US. Audio quality is great as well. Layout is well-organized. However, my biggest issue with the app is the repeated purchasing issues I have been having. I could not use my credits until I deleted and reinstalled the app, despite being a brand new user. After a couple weeks of use, I once again am unable to purchase a book. Please fix.

I drive an incr edible amount of time and truly enjoy Audible and the books selections. However, I have never been able to stop the auto-play feature at all. When Bluetooth is enabled it automatically starts playing whenever/wherever! I literally have to disable Bluetooth to get it to stop. Help is of little use. Otherwise, very good at keeping me entertained while on the road. Aside from the one issue it is a highly recommended app.

I have been using the app for years. It would be an improvement if you could see the price $ of books in your wishlist on the app without having to go to the website. Another improvement would be being able to sort the books you own by genre. it would be helpful picking your next listen. Sometimes you know what type of book you want. Its annoying going through all of them. oh and we all hate AI narrators. actually going to take a star off for AI narrators.

I am not a reader, never have been, so audiobooks are a lifeline. Generally speaking the mobile app is good, but it could use an update. If I'm not listening to a book or podcast, then I feel there is too much content offered on one screen and searching isn't optimal. I very much appreciate the preview feature since I am picky about narrators, and I infrequently encounter issues listening to my audible of choice.

the app still crashes every now and then forcing me to reopen it or still randomly pauses. it has decreased significantly. I love the audio books. I wish there were more options for free books, they seem to keep pretty centered on the genre for free ones... or at least maybe add in an extra credit for the base price or have more sales in books. I also wish they had more full cast audio productions. otherwise I love the app.

I love the app. I've got over 500 audio books and I've listened to at least 350 of em all the way through. I have 2 complaints with the app though. I hate that it will install some books without permission and I can't figure out how to turn it off, I don't care if they are free. also there needs to be an easier way to transfer books you bought into files for other players. currently the software offers no way to listen to things you already purchased outside Audible.

You can get the audio books easily enough, but the app itself is spotty about when it decides to work. It cuts off randomly with seemingly no reason. it decides not to load the player and therefore you can't skip, rewind, or pause. It doesn't always save progress so you end up lost as to where you were. If Netflix and the other dozen video apps can do it then this should be easy. Invest in your app Audible, it's all you are.

There are a couple of ui/qol issues I hope they may improve someday. The first is for finding the next book in a series when the book you're enjoying is about to end/has completed. There should be an easy option to buy the next book without having to go through multiple menus. Second, if a favorited book is on sale, display it first. Third, add a "play next" queue so that people don't have to stop what they're doing to select a book.

I like Audible the service, and the app itself is a good platform. It could be better if 1. they had a link to allow you to buy the physical book (ironic given its partnership with AMZ) because some books really need to be read too. Many come with downloadable pdfs which is a HUGE help but it's only going to be key graphics/content the author decides to include with the audiobook. 2. the bookmarks need to recede the mark by at least 30 seconds, especially in car mode-before u realize the value.

I love my audible. So many book options. Plus free originals every month. And with their wish list, I can keep track of the books I want to get, and am notified when they go on sale. It's also nice to be able to go from phone, to laptop, to tablet and never lose my place. 10-9-25 - for whatever reason the new update has screwed stuff up. I still love audible but the sleep timer doesn't work correctly anymore. it stops randomly whether using the timed timer, or the end of chapter timer.

Doesn't play well with Android. It default plays, even when the app isn't running. When playing it can't be accessed in the drop-down menu. If I get out of my car with music playing, when I get back in a book starts playing in the musical place; Even when the app was not running in background! This means I have to find the app just to turn it off. This also applied to other Bluetooth devices, but less consistently. I love the value of audible, but the app has nearly always been a mess..

title: Triple Tile: Match Puzzle Game
description:
Discover Triple Tile ‚Äì your new favorite tile match puzzle game!
Step into the relaxing yet exciting world of puzzle games with Triple Tile, the ultimate tile match challenge. The goal is simple: find a triple match to clear the board. Whether you‚Äôre a casual gamer or a seasoned match 3 expert, this beautifully designed match game will keep you coming back

With easy-to-learn mechanics and endless possibilities, Triple Tile delivers the perfect blend of relaxation and brain-teasing fun. If you love matching games, you‚Äôll be right at home.

Why You‚Äôll Love Triple Tile
FIND YOUR ZEN ‚Äì Tap, match, and relax with calming puzzle games that delight both the eyes and the mind. With our stunning visuals, every match game feels like a work of art.
TRAIN YOUR BRAIN ‚Äì Every level is a clever tile match puzzle designed to challenge. Sharpen your skills as you rise to triple match mastery.
EXPLORE BEAUTIFUL WORLDS ‚Äì Track your tile game progress on a vibrant map and unlock stunning new destinations. From tranquil beaches to lush forests, every chapter brings a fresh backdrop to your matching games journey.
NEVER RUN OUT OF TILE GAME FUN ‚Äì With thousands of match 3 levels and regular updates, Triple Tile keeps your tile match skills sharp with new puzzles every week.

How to Play
Clear the board by completing a triple match ‚Äì just find and combine three identical tiles. Sounds simple? Wait until you see the clever twists, layered challenges, and surprising layouts that make this one of the most addictive puzzle games out there.

Triple Tile is the perfect tile game to enjoy anytime, anywhere ‚Äì even without an internet connection. Play offline and keep the fun going whether you‚Äôre traveling, commuting, or just relaxing at home with your favorite tile game.

Triple Tile is perfect to unwind, sharpen your mind, and immerse yourself in a satisfying match game experience. Triple Tile offers a tile game experience that‚Äôs easy to pick up yet endlessly rewarding. Every tile game level will keep you challenged, engaged, and coming back for more

Download Triple Tile today and see why so many tile match puzzle fans can‚Äôt put it down. It‚Äôs time to tap, match, and master your way to the top
